Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y4xTbCrq0G8aaM63fmp1IA.text: The hostess was a doll but dinner went downhill from there. Group of 9 with reservations at 7:30 on a Saturday in October. I'm not sure if the server was trying to pace us so slowly but this dinner dragged on forever.   They were out of both Halibut and Lobster. Not even enough lobster to go into the mac & cheese. Very disappointing. I asked for the bread once we put in drink orders and began ordering entrees, and the server told me there was a protocol. And to wait. We had already been there 30 minutes? Give me the bread for love of.... (Spoiler:Bread was anticlimactic).   Food arrives. Nothing stood out to me. We ordered brussel sprouts, mac & cheese, green beans, steaks, Steak was cooked well but no flavor. How disappointing! Worst steak I've had in Vegas. I'm so sad to have to say that.   All the credit for me not leaving this place and abandoning the group goes to my dear JC. He had me laughing the whole night. Harder than I've laughed, since college. So, if you're coming here, make sure you bring a good friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steals a la carte

CF3irdmlfnGqgsLkdR2rVw.text: We haven't often done the high end Steakhouse in Vegas, in part because we have so many great steak places at home. But an accident of timing and cuisine led us to eat at Morels, which bills itself as a French steakhouse but which was in actuality a lot more Steakhouse than it was French.   The environment is spacious and light. The menu is large and diverse, with a great cheese selection as a lot of normal steakhouse fare. Service was attentive and flexible. Great overall environment.  Our food was prepared well, tasted delicious and met our expectations. It was pricey, but not ridiculous. Nothing at the restaurant stood out as amazing, This definitely fits with other great steak places we've been to, but not in our favourites.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato, to which I had them add the cheddar from the cheese menu.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac and cheese.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp appetizer

hEMZFXRhey5jBc7A8KcAVw.text: Had dinner here with my son and fiance Yesterday.  I ordered the Alaskan Halibut it was delectable! My son ordered Filet Mignon.. Oscar style, he loved it and left nothing on his plate except the asparagus. My fiance ordered the Bone in NY sirloin he said it was to char for his taste. Server gave us 3 type of exotic salt we added these into our dish and the result was amazing. The Mashed potatoes and Brussel Sprouts was very appetizing. Overall our experience her was great the staff and servers was all super friendly and very efficient.

mjzI204mQju8goTxhi5Omw.text: Food is not special at all , very basic. I don't see the value to pay for it. I try so many good steak house, definite not this one.

cX7yGA_FApUU8xj83KDtsA.text: Morel's fronts a lovely elegant setting with an attentive, friendly and efficient wait staff. My rating is based on what came out of the kitchen for our meal. My manhattan cocktail was spectacular! Initially we were served much welcomed dinner rolls. My friends appeared nice and brown on top however the 2 served me were pale and upon eating just were not cooked enough and slightly doughy. Subsequent ones served  to the table were the same as my first ones. I ordered the Pork Milinaise $32 which was listed on the menu as being a panko crusted bone in pork chop. What I was served was a very thin large pork tenderloin "cutlet" which was overcooked, burned, to the point of almost impossible to cut and the bite I did manage to cut was cold and dry as a bone. I am not one to frequently send something back but this time I did and the wait person immediately acknowledged the issues and asked if I wanted a different dish. A management person came by and apologized. I then ordered the 18 hour cooked short ribs $39. These came out shortly and were nice enough but not anything to rave about. The meat itself was also a bit overdone and dry even though covered in sauce. The mini carrots on the plate had obviously seen a cooking pan however were room temperature and were rock hard the pearl onions were also undercooked but edible. Our brussel sprouts side was overcooked and had way too much char. The sauteed squash were overcooked and too soft as well, the table finished neither.  I feel as though  for a restaurant of this calibre the wait person should have caught  the major issues with my pork dish and have not even served it. It was in no way as stated on the menu and obviously way over done. The short ribs were ok and decent enough but just that. All of the other items had issues in the cooking that just shouldn't be overall. Thus my rating of 2 stars.

lBVrQeeYpiWWGWMDjUXtug.text: Place is ok, food takes awhile to come out. The salmon was not bad but wished it was ok something with more starch than lentil. Cheese board wasn't bad as well.

22TkJk6ymPOzy-jVI1kOdg.text: Terrible service and one of the worst steakhouses I have every experienced. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. They make you feel rushed and the food is sub-par. I ordered a rib-eye and it was not tender at all. My party ordered medium and it turned out to be rare and pink.   The best part was the dessert specifically the macaroons. Never again. Needs better management. Server walked by us multiply times and not once asked how our food was.

eG4Vgn7zuNo9vx8jiwnqGw.text: Very friendly and welcoming staff. Indoor decor is absolutely stunning as well. Outdoor seating allows for some sightseeing and people watching lol   I ordered the Salmon Benedict with a cup of coffee. I'm not a huge fan of Hollandaise sauce, but the description just looked appetizing. Safe to say I left satiated.

KiS5XL52NZNQ3YChyAJvag.text: Okay, I know it's a steakhouse and I should be ordering some red meat but I know from previous experience that a good steakhouse can be counted on for some of the best red wine and premium liqueurs. I was not disappointed. The G&T Magnifique uses Bombay Blue Sapphire gin but the real trick is an infused ice cube with a sprig of rosemary. The house made tonic is a bit sweet for my taste, but overall, a most delightful cocktail!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IM_bnimX7AU6mHvcG33RGA.text: Way over priced, food is at best a C-.  Service the same.  Steaks were dry.  No salt and pepper on the table.  Waiter spilled a glass of wine on two guests.  They use peanut oil in their fryer and didn't tell us and one guest had a peanut allergy.  Seating is terrible.  Everyone  is packed in like sardines.   There are much better options in the Venetian and surrounding area.

G-mjciyAhn24IqprCdBT9g.text: Classic Good. Brandon and the team took good care of us for brunch and kept the bottomless mimosas flowing !   It's quality service and quality food - we will be back - very soon! Thanks guys !

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Baked Cinnamon Beignets
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Pancakes
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Benedict

ur9wJkE4aSP2z4FrZxI8yA.text: This is a slightly 'above average' steakhouse in the VENETIAN. The wine collection is nice and the seafood as well. Steaks were good according to my friends. I liked the shrimps and the lobster. What I did not like was the chicken breast as an alternative to steak. Wasnt good at all actually. I asked for advice on the same and I was told because they are a Steakhouse! Well, get rid of the item from your menu, if thats the case!

K353U0InLditDoPDzwQcVg.text: Went for breakfast on a recent trip to Vegas.  We were staying at Encore but wanted to eat breakfast somewhere else so we walked over to this restaurant because it had good reviews. Sat outside before it got too hot. Was very pleasant outside and nice view of the strip. Food and service were great. I had the avocado toast and it was terrific. Also got a Bloody Mary that was made table side. Would definitely return to this restaurant on our next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side Bloody Mary service

hAw-Z2_bQAgXzJFh7y8OcQ.text: Fantastic service and exceptional food! The Caesar salad made table-side was a highlight, once of the best Caesars I've ever eaten. Wine list is also very good, a nice selection of price points and regions. Pricey, but that's to be expected for a steakhouse on The Strip.

r276nEFYy64Hxy-m4ggabQ.text: We came in for dinner on a Saturday night and were greeted by an incredibly rude hostess. That's where I'll begin! She was really impatient and rude to our group of eight for unknown reasons. Once we were seated, Jerry the weirdo manager came over, introduced himself, and proceeded to lay four copies of his business card on the table. It was really strange and entirely unwanted. Marina was our waitress and she was majorly lacking in the personality department. She was abrasive and just not nice. She also seemed like she couldn't be bothered with our group. Mind you that we were not being loud, unruly, or disrespectful in any way. The prices were pretty outrageous. We paid $60 for a bottle of Malbec and that was cheap based on the cost for any other wine. I ordered the 8 oz filet mignon and it was cooked perfectly. Was it a nearly $60 steak? No. I also had the mushrooms and mashed potatoes and both sides came out cold. To sum it up: the service is poor and the food isn't worth the price.

NF72cQAUOjGUEYH5A_fY6w.text: A friend and I wanted to try something new for Restaurant Week.  Morels was on both of our lists to try so it worked out perfectly.    Being that I gave up desserts this year, I didn't order from the restaurant week menu as they come with a delicious treat.  I did however enjoy an amazing sandwich that I'm sure I will be back for.    I chose the Croque Monsieur.  A delicious French originated sandwich! They mold this sandwich together with country ham, gruyere cheese & sauce mornay enclosed in sourdough.   Each bite was delectable.  The sauce had a rich flavor which was drizzled over the entire sandwich.  It really takes a grilled cheese to another level.  The service was friendly.  It was somewhat spotty as we waited long periods in between seeing him and also to get our check.  The food certainly out-weighed the service so it wouldn't prevent me from coming again.  I loved the cuisine and dining area.  The elegant and pristine setting would be enjoyed by all.  Merci, beaucoup!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the Croque Monsieur
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croque Monsieur
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

ZE889z-CSChOQy4b_SwJIg.text: Stopped by to have some wine and a cheese plate on the outdoor patio last week and it was great.  The cheese selection is fantastic, the wine paired perfectly with the food, and the service was exceptional!  Our waiter was Eric W and he went out of his way to help us with menu recommendations and a birthday dessert - thanks for making our afternoon so enjoyable!!

sdeV4N-NW0w6GMiufU8Kkw.text: Located inside the Palazzo, on a nice day if you get a table outside on the patio, you get a really good view of the strip. Service was great, people were really nice!  However, the food was just alright for the price. My boyfriend got the rib eye steak, ordered it medium and got it very rare. When he asked to get the steak recooked, it came back nearly burnt on the outside. My other friend ordered the same thing and got it medium well. For a steakhouse, I would think this should be their best dish. I got the 18 hour braised short rib. Actually, it wasn't that bad at all! The sauce they provide goes really well with the meat, and you get a little bit of a "side" with it, so it help take a break from all the meat. The only downside was the meat was a bit on the dry side if I didn't pour the sauce all over it. Luckily they provide extra sauce on the side, just in case.

noJ_8wkKzeb_5z5b9oHLfA.text: I have been to this location as well as the the Los Angeles location. Wasn't so great this time. My girlfriend is in town as a corporate rep for NASCAR; and considers restaurants for banquets. I brought them here thinking it would be a great candidate for a big event. My onion soup was nice, as always. However, the quiche Lorraine was unsavory, gelatinous even.. and when we asked for the server to have them cook it a bit further, she came back and told me that the chef said, "that's how he makes it." Then, after all, the server also "miscalculated" our payment, and kept cash from us. A little coaching for their team would be helpful. When we spoke to the manager, he was dismissive, and inconsiderate. We WILL NOT be back.

GR4nni9qjSZVTd_R7GT9wA.text: Good food good service thou pricey. It's Vegas n it's inside the hotel. Expected.  We had the salmon rillette. Good.  Tuna tartare. Above average. Still good.  The bread w butter n mashed olive spread. Good.  I wanted medium well 14 oz prime ny for my kids to share. It came out well done but still juicy so acceptable.  Had 6 pieces of raw oysters. Not bad but not that great. May be because they were not that busy. Server said because they are usually a convention guests restaurant where there's a corporate credit card that can be charged to, in other words expensive! I recommend it. Not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That salmon thingy

Ej3b2BBCUMd_0SpIOSoFGw.text: Waited 2 hours to sit. Unbelievably delayed, then rushed at the table by the waiter. It's 3 hrs before I got my entree. No discounts, no apologies. Terrible

2_p9payCWt4veJYVa2bNnQ.text: So... our party has been coming here as repeat customers for quite some time. Here this week for "Shot Show" and took clients to what I thought was one of my favorite steak houses. eight people in our party for at 6:45pm reservation... got our dinner at 9:00pm. The main waiter was obviously overwhelmed and out of his league! With all due respect do was the manager that made a very limited, and in fact weak attempt to compensate for the five (5) dinners that were less than up to par for what a Vegas premier steak house would be proud of! All said and done I give a 1 star review because there was no lesser option. My next Vegas bust WILL NOT include Morels... as I will gladly spend my $$$ at Delmonico's. Needless to say very disappointed this visit... how's the saying go: if I'm happy I'll tell ten people, but if I'm unhappy I'll tell 100 people!

D6vvDES66lMeq3gIcLCQdQ.text: Yvette the bartender is the BOMB at this place. She is extremely professional and on it when it comes to service. She recommended a fabulous French white wine (see my pictures) and it was exactly what I wanted, crisp, dry and delicious. My friends and I decided to have some appetizers at the bar and everything was absolutely amazing. We sampled the cheese and meat platter, an ahi tuna appetizer (YUUUUUUMMM) and fresh fruit sorbets. There was a very nice selection of gourmet cheeses served with bread crostini. The ahi was really delish, a little stack of tuna and served with airy potato chips. We loved everything! Very flavorful, service excellent, very cool ambiance. As a local, I usually avoid the strip like the plague. This is one of the few places I am willing to go to the strip to check out.. totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fabulous
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert sorbet  mmm
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and meat platter. Cheeses are so delish

8Pt8vHWw7yLyX7PwYsDATg.text: Worst most overpriced place ever.. horrible food and inconvenient service. Stay away!

PyEiV10XOzJ62Ok1_3x5qA.text: Briche was such an amazing waitress! So kind and accommodating. Also the best coffee I've ever had. Such a great place for bottomless mimosas as well! Would come back here every morning!!

xp2OIPFDbb7_XoQl7ZPEOw.text: Very good steaks but the starters were really bland. Ran out of short drink glasses.  Also ran out of the baked Alaska at 7:00 pm. Great balcony. The prices really high

m-IlD4fbXUOEdHlpd3ridQ.text: This is definitely one of my favorite places in Vegas. It's a steakhouse, however we never tried the steak there. We always go with the seafood and French onion soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best french onion soup
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite seafood plate

b1aL-GEcCg4HFBF5As3wIg.text: Best kept secret, the breakfast here is fantastic and the fresh press coffee is amazing!  The staff is so friendly and the service is on point! We will be back for breakfast every day we are in Vegas.

zG54BglhCnIMmRfiv1-10Q.text: We enjoyed a relatively late new year's eve dinner (10:00pm).  The top reasons I made reservations for Morels a couple of weeks before were:  1. Proximity to the strip.  It's right by the Palazzo entrance.  Easy for us to run out and see the fireworks in 30 seconds.     2.  They were serving the a la carte menu unlike a lot of other restaurants that night doing some $250+ per person prix fixe bs.  I'd rather just do the full meal deal at Joel Robuchon instead paying that kind of money for overpriced NYE menus at Comme Ca, Koi or holy crap god forbid Sugar Factory.    3.  STEAK  Our starters were the "Onion Soup Gratinee" and the "Pan Seared French Rougie Foie Gras".  The soup was a 3 out of 5.  We prefer our onion soups a little more robust and wine flavored where this was kind of sweet.  It was a hearty portion as it should be for $10 but not worth ordering again.    The foie gras on the other hand was deeeeeelicious.  It was accompanied by caramelized red onion, candied apples and balsamic reduction.  There's just something about the fatty and unique flavor of the duck liver with fruit that I can't get enough of.  Restaurants in Vegas like Andre's and Gordon Ramsay Steak do it really well and this was right up there.    For the entree, we chose not to mess around and just went with the 32 oz porterhouse for two prepared rare.  They served it tableside and it came with roasted rosemary potatoes, fricassee of baby turnips, sauce Bordelaise, onions & carrots.  We asked to keep the bone as always either in hopes of being ambitious a few days later and using it to make beef noodle soup at home or just gnawing at the bone while walking down the street like a couple of insane canines later in the evening.  The steak was very good.  32 oz is a monster cut and we were only able to finish half and box the rest.  I actually preferred the sirloin side over the filet this time around which was kind of surprising for me.  All in all a very solid choice for steak but still not close to the best steaks in their own building thanks to Mr. Batali and Mr. Puck.  I would come back here for happy hour and also when it's warmer to dine outdoors.

LwHWnBZzMF7IrnL5cBkW-A.text: We popped in for lunch while staying at the Palazzo and checked out Morels.  Really nice setting but we just went for a simple lunch.  Definitely a high end restaurant.  We had a beef deep and cob salad.  Both were very nice but by the time you had ice tea, coffee, and tip, lunch is $60.  So a relaxing lunch but not for the budget conscious.  They also have a patio area that looked nice.

DgUcOQo8tsu-o7QThaJ0qQ.text: We had very high hopes for the evening as our group of 12 arrived for our reservation. Drinks were ok if you believe a bleu cheese stuffed olive should be smaller than a marble.  Appetizers arrived and the tower of seafood was amazing....but that's where the evening came off the tracks. A second round of drinks escaped our servers mind, steaks arrived...cold...after more than an hour between courses. The sides were good (asparagus, potatoes and mushrooms) but arrived a full 10 minutes after the cold steaks. The 14oz ribeye had good flavor but wasn't outstanding. Decided to forgo dessert since our "adventure was pushing 3.75 hours already. All in all service lacks any sense of urgency or timing and food was mediocre.

_J6o4aY-8i5yoFV1GhNTWw.text: Waiter awesome! Gave us free champaign, but food horrible.  Ambience none!  Come here if you want to be depressed

-NMMu5x7uZ2YFaYaINLqvg.text: How does this place stay in business? It is the worst. Service slow. We had to ask the woman to get our food, which was clearly sitting under a heat lamp. Food horrible. My crab Benedict was mostly flavorless and the dry crab tasted more like the sealegs than the real crab and instead of an english muffin, they slapped on a piece of white bread. Over priced. $21 for eggs benedict, $17 for a bloody mary (which was actually the highlight of the meal). Atmosphere: Horrible  oversized picture of sex scenes seem more appropriate in a strip bar than a French Restaurant. I guess they can eek out an existence because they have a rotating customer base to wander in. I can't imagine there is one repeat customer. I know we won't be.

lxycrXUViNyquvlW45Yu5g.text: Came here for Three Square Restaurant Week lunch menu on Aug 31, 2011.  Soup of the day was butternut squash soup, it was more black pepper than butternut squash, but texture was good.  The server took it away before I could finish all of it.  The salad was large and dressing was excellent.  The crispy salmon was excellent as the salmon was perfectly cooked with a very light, yet crispy skin.  The salmon was served on a bed of lentils, carrots, and mushrooms, very tasty.  The steak frite was asked to be cooked medium rare, but it came out more medium well on the thin side, and medium on the thicker side.  It was very tender though.  The french fries are excellent!  Light and crispy, my dad couldn't stop eating them.  The strawberry ice cream for dessert was the most flavorful strawberry ice cream I have every had with a wonderful whip cream.    We got there early right before 12 noon and it was pretty empty, the service started out a little slow as we had to wait a couple minutes for the menus and water.  Otherwise, the rest of service was excellent, staff was friendly and prompt.    I would not normally eat here as it is located on the strip, but for Restaurant week, I wanted to give it a try.  I am glad I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week housemade strawberry ice cream
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week steak frites
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week crispy salmon

JAmyO8U0ufh-sQuAEAbYlA.text: Not a fan of the Palazzo or many of its restaurants but very pleasantly surprised by Morels! Had the best bartender/server, Yvette. She suggested incredible wine, the freshest oysters and a delicious selection of cheese. Very sexy ambiance and decor. Very pleased!! I would recommend others here. I enjoy upscale places like this and would definitely come here again!! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t get much better than Jordan, the finest cheese and the freshest oysters!!!

eE1qKBEGgtJLdJegf1BuVA.text: Had breakfast there with Palazzo 20% discount. We had 2 Egg Benedicts.. the bill was $45... the Eggs Benedict were the worst we ever had. Both my wife and i  didn't finish either of them. Save your money. A real ripe off.... explains why there were  so few  in the restaurant ...

GfzNWGJ4Yx1hRhxKhAB7uQ.text: Have not yelped in a while, but I felt last nights service deserved this. We went here with a friend for drinks and appetizers and sat at the bar, place was nice, music ok. But what made our night was the bartenders. Chelsea and Mohammed both talked to us about wine, scotch and food.  I got a nice Yamasaki, which the bartender Mohammed seemed to know a lot about. He spoke to us about the history of and other great recommendations. Then with dinner had a bottle of wine, which the Som recommend, but for the life of me I could not remember the name. Food came out, which was ok, had the petite fillet, which was cooked right. But honestly it's not a Gallagher's steak.  The Brussels sprouts were cooked too much for my taste, then we finished dinner with a nice Suntory Whiskey Toki and good laughs with the bartenders!  Again the bar is where it's at for this place. Would really recommend again if these guys are working!

iU7A_oGpKa2GiIiWNRHmsA.text: Went for brunch and the bottomless mimosas really felt bottomless. I could not count how many I had because my glass was constantly refilled. I had the huevos rancheros and added bacon( which was a fantastic idea!) and it was very yummy. Patio seating was nice and prices were very reasonable for being on the strip. (25$ mimosas, dish was 16$) Overall, it was a nice experience and I will return when family comes in town.

y5YLKeeq1wG3n3Zx6zGjHw.text: Oysters good. Scallops good. Bread good. Salmon fair. Philly steak sandwich the absolute worse. Service fair.

pC1NItBfB0LjELgdUX-RDg.text: We chose Morels simply for one reason, it was the only place with cheese fondue on the menu for an appetizer where the prices were not outrageous. 6 of us dined for lunch and the prices were very reasonable.   Pluses: Onion Gratin soup, French dip sandwich, cheese fondue for two or more, croque monsieur. Service was outstanding.   Minuses: Cheese fondue was only served with bread. For $10 per person , we were expecting more "dippers".   All in all, a pleasant experience.

EXUuF2g9dheJDsONjK2tDw.text: Incredible service.  Bottomless mimosas!  Delicious crab cake benedicts.  Good portions (what portions should be, not excessive).  Bloody Mary's made at the table.  Fancy white linens but not pompous whatsoever.  Conveniently located at the Palazzo so you can slowly stumble over after a long night out.  I liked it :)

f7lIKYbuVTqPDEDrB8o_IA.text: What a disappointment!!! We were recommended this restaurant for a birthday celebration. First off the waiter was rude when we asked for service after being seated and waiting 30 mins before anyone came to our table. Then a member in our party cracked a tooth on a olive pit that was in the tapenade. The steak knife brought to the table for my steak was dirty. When I asked for a clean one the waiter was again rude. When the food arrived(in stages, not all together) it was tasty enough but the pasta shrimp dish had shells on it!! Would not recommend this place!!! Very unhappy!!!

9fLBwQYNmwIwpmfJttOyDQ.text: The inside of Morels is nice, classy and bright white/black decor.  If you are hung over, caution, you may need sunglasses.  The service is also good except we never got offered bread to start the meal. Anyway, I hardly judge a restaurant by service or looks alone or what the wait staff did or didn't forget to bring.    The crab benedict was a delight to look at.  The taste was also pretty good.  Fresh crabs, a delightful citrus hollandaise.  However, the poached egg was cooked solid.  The yolk was not running at all, and last time I checked, a perfectly poached egg has runny yolk.  That is a definitely cooking faux pas.  Unforgivable.  Definitely headed to Bouchon instead, next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fhRZy2oQealoW7zOZgm78A.text: Skip this place at all costs. You've been warned.   It should be a sign that a French steakhouse on the strip is completely empty the majority of the time- because ANYWHERE else would be a better choice.   Over priced for the quality of service, ambience, and food.   Service- HORRIBLE customer service. Just awful. I'm not sure who was our actual waiter because our first waiter made a HUGE, clumsy, rookie mistake (I don't want to go into details about that, because for benefit of the doubt it was a freak accident, not an everyday occurrence) and was swept away before he could even apologize. At least 3 other waiters took his place. Unfortunately quantity didn't equal quality. All lacked professionalism for this being a more "classy" restaurant. The real problem though is the manager. The manager of this restaurant needs to take charge, have a mandatory customer service training for his staff, and remember that the customers are important and it is his job to make sure they leave happy, full, and satisfied! The way the "clumsy mistake" was handled was NOT okay. Not by a long shot and that was definitely the worst part of the whole dining experience.    Ambience- It was basically empty except one or two other tables. This was 730 on a weekend night. Besides the actual restaurant, the bathrooms looked like they haven't been remodeled since before the Palazzo was built, and the soap used to wash your hands is the same kind you get at the dollar store, Softsoap, and it was obvious water had been added to it to make it last longer.    Food- food was just okay. Not bad, but not something worth going back for. There are better steaks that are cooked how you ordered them, all over the strip. The tartare was served with what looked and tasted like ruffles potato chips. Sauces and salts were brought to the table without an explanation of which was which.   If you want a "fancy" meal on the strip, or are craving a good steak, don't just settle for this place because of convenience or short wait time! There's a reason! You will be disappointed.    As a side note, we were given a name and email by the Palazzo to express our experience at Morels, whom we emailed within an hour of our meal. It's been over 72 hours and we still have not received a response.

xvyA61CCsSr7GZdIFcGuSg.text: I like reviewing places on three criteria: atmosphere, food and service. Being this is the Palazzo, you know the first two are going to be top notch so I really want to give props to our waiter, Brandon. (Tall one with the beard, I'm told there are three.) The Wife and I are on our honeymoon and stopped in for a quick lunch, and right off the bat, he gave us the business for our Red Sox hats (Guess I wont hold his being a Yankee fan against him. Nobody's perfect!) and knew pretty quick this guy was going to clique with us.  The Wife ordered the Croque monsieur and I ordered the French dip and of course a few drinks. Both were excellent! Just the right meal at the right time for the fun we were having in 110 degree Vegas heat, Not too heavy, just right.  So Brandon brings me a sample of the house brewed pilsner, which was very tasty, and for a bit we chat him up and get the run down on what a local would do and see when in Vegas, talk Bout baseball, home and long and short, he made the meal, had some good advice  and it was one of those experiences your going to tell your friends about when you go back home.  Thanks tall bearded Brandon!

CZ1hlNslx6tuWsck5nFAxQ.text: Came here not by choice but for a wedding reception and for the price u pay u would expect to have a great experience with excellent services and remarkable food. It was just mediocre and nothing more.  The hostess greets us nicely and confirm our reservations with 5 tables and made recommendations which I appreciate. We were all seated and our orders were all taken the same time. Altho the hostess were friendly, the waiters could have been more organize and communicate with each other and their tables. By the end of the night 4 out of 5 tables were served. Our friends at the 5th table did not get their dinner at all. The waiters did not want to take ownership at first. They blame the other waiters and the other blame the cooks and for a good 10min came with a conclusion that our friends at the 5th table should just pay for what they consume. One of our friend was so upset he put down his money for the dinner he did not receive and walked out while our couple friends did not agree and ask for a manger to make it right. After another 10min they finally made it right.  As for the food, I ordered the short ribs and it was above average but I enjoy the mushrooms and free complimentary bread more. My bf ordered the NY steak and did enjoy it but made a remark about for the price it was it should have came with sides. We both agree this would be a one time experience and would not come back again.  I would have rated it a two star but I gaved it a three because of the friendly hostess and the manager finally making it right for our friends at table 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My $37 short ribs roasted for 18hrs. Very tender but wish it had a lil more sauce.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bf ordered a $55 NY steak &amp; can&#39;t grasp why ot didn&#39;t come with any sides

Usii5aOAbLVlYUaurjH1Fg.text: Last night, my friends flew in from San Francisco. Morels was sophisticated, classy with a European touch. The steak was absolutely grilled with precision. Our entire party was impressed with the giant oysters. Fresh and delicious. Our bartender was sweet, extremely kind, great service. Thank you.

Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TaH2nXib46GD0Sb_9HuP7w.text: I have mixed feelings about my dinner experience, the assorted meat and cheese charcuterie was truly amazing. The attention to detail and tastes were so good. The beet salad was very bland and nothing special about it. Once the main course arrived I had the 14 oz. Rib eye which had to be sent back, the meat was so hard and tough for a Prime quality, and I had it done medium. I had it changed out for a petite filet, which really wasn't anything great. Dessert was very good, done table side Chocolate mouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 14 oz. Rib eye that I had to send back. Done medium, but so hard and tough.

ZfX-YwZ9WFkZDwJvYqN5vQ.text: Came here for a bachelorette brunch and was pleasantly surprised. If I could enjoy this place hungover and drunk at the same time, anyone can enjoy this place. The onion soup is amazing and so are the crepes. Honestly, the size of those suckers was tremendous! You would think they would skimp out because its a 'high-end vegas restaurant' but not at all! For the price, you definitely get enough food to keep you pleasantly full. The staff was very prompt and friendly but then again I've only been here for brunch and have yet to experience dinner. I know there are some negative reviews about the staff but I have yet to experience that... I guess til' next time Morel's!   Brunch - A-Ok Dinner - To be continued...

sOPa8yW7RT4r31_Yj6sptA.text: Great wait staff, not so great food experience, overpriced and lacked any type of creativity. Perhaps time for a menu overhaul ? Brunch? Not !order ala cart off the menu, when did that represent a brunch, I have no hunch, wouldn't go back even for lunch.

dVmn-YnQ9tUZ05uFvG_kjg.text: We had 7pm reservations. Sat out on the balcony. Nice view of the area. The service started off very well. Had the 2010 Jordan Cabernet Sauvignon. It was a nice wine. Had the scallops as a starter. Very nicely done. Had the tomohawk rib eye and lobster surf-n-turf.  Very nice presentation. Lobster was excellent. Rib eye tasted kind of bland for what I paid.  Than they forgot about us. Requested support from other staff members but because we weren't their customer, they didn't care.  In order to get a 5 they need to finish what they started with good service and improve the taste of the steak. This dinner was too expensive for what I paid for.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomohawk rib eye

4tPta8e0tRUC-mhqlmvjUw.text: Brian Simon was an outstanding bartender!  He is so professional yet extremely friendly!  He made us feel very welcome!  We will definitely visit again!   Great happy hour prices!

GwX81D7Dq9EnTcYR3nGXow.text: This was a fun pit stop between day clubs and eating lol We stayed in the bar area. It was intimate, well designed, relaxing and they have a great drink selection. The only negative was due to our server, he was rude and spoke to us like we were somewhat stupid. We had asked him as to what champagnes he had per glass to which he responded "the ones that are on the menu" we asked for his suggestion - we preferred something a bit more dry , he responded that he said that all the champagnes were dry and the same. I don't understand why work in such an upscale place if you choose to not interact with clients or care to suggest. Disappointing.

qI3AnPZjTAiZTzCRYvUz9g.text: My colleagues and I visited for a client lunch. Honestly, I was disappointed. We had a party of 6 and were initially seated at a table, which was only inches away from other tables on all sides. One of my colleagues said it felt like a cafeteria setting, and I couldn't have agreed more. In addition, the chair coverings reminded me of a cheap banquet hall. Thankfully, we were able to get a circular table before our client arrived. The food was pretty average. We ordered the calamari and coconut shrimp to start (average). A few of us ate the french onion soup (average). Several people wanted to order the filet mignon; however, to our disappointment, they were out of filets?! It shocked me becaues you'd think that a place that had "steakhouse" in the name would always have this item available. Unfortunately, not that day. I ordered the greek salad with chicken, and it was again... average. The dressing was a little funky; chicken was dry. All in all, a pretty big let down. The only real upside was that the wait staff was very attentive throughout our meal and extremely friendly. I would avoid Morel's if possible!

-CtQulUcr3DZhv4FLnvd2A.text: Celebrated our Anniversary at Morels Steakhouse and dined using their Summer Tasting Menu.  Four courses (Starter, App, Salad and Entree) for $45.  We also opted for the wine pairing, 4 wines for $20. A great deal overall, but be aware the wine pours are a tasting only, so about 1-2 oz each.  The courses are all reduced from full sizes, but with the four it was satisfying enough, however the food itself was fairly standard.  Starter course: Curry Shrimp (very good) / Fried Calamari (not as tender as it should be). App course: Beef Slider and fries (Beef overcooked, Fries very good) / Mussels (Very small mussels and the broth too watery and salty to be enjoyed with bread). Third course: Greek Salad (some of lettuce was bitter, but olives were wonderful) / Caesar salad (very standard). Entree course: Top Sirloin and Potato Puree (well cooked and good) / Same Top Sirloin but added Crab Oscar (Cooked to temp as requested, but crab was very tiny and strings of crab (canned?) and Bearnaise was pretty hard to find on top).  Overall the food was good, and nothing that would be sent back to the kitchen, but was a bit too normal for the reputation of Morels Steakhouse in Vegas.  The service was top of the line, from the seating through the end of the meal.  They  all were aware of our celebration, and from host to server to manager, all congratulated us on our anniversary, along with a complimentary dessert of Creme Brule, which was the best part of the meal.  Sad to say, excellent service will only last a short time, as the food is why we all go, so for the price and food quality, there are other competitors in Vegas that will probably gain my business in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top Sirloin with Crab Oscar - Steak good, but skip the Crab Oscar (small pieces of crab and minimal Bernnaise)
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Shrimp and Naan bread - very good
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari with spicy sauce

WsY3XIyOgpgN8O2E-pB9mQ.text: We ate breakfast here one morning.  It was $50.00 and was just ok.  I found the coffee expensive and bitter.  I wasn't impressed with the coffee which can make or break a breakfast as far as I'm concerned.  My eggs came with brioche which was soso, it was not the greatest tasting bread.    I would be inclined to go back and try it for diner but I wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast.  The decor was nice and the service good.  Just not anything extraordinary.

HwTKHfazej3JjOM7SzrH3g.text: Had 3 great experiences dining at Morels on our trip to Vegas last month. We had breakfast twice. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. Compared to other French bistros nearby, it's the best value. My husband and I also had wine and charcuterie at the bar. The cheese selection is huge and we were able to try some unique cheeses. The bartender was helpful and brought out complimentary garlic confit and salts that accompanied the cheeses we selected. The wine selection is also top notch.  We were not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G6PT7cPtRFrFEYtj3r-EEA.text: When in Vegas, do as the Veygans do, they dine at really nice steakhouses. And what better way to do than then by going to my favorite hotel in Vegas, the Palazzo and eating at Morels Steakhouse.  But I do have to say, the real reason I came here, what excited me so much, was actually the cheese and mushroom souffle. I love chocolate souffle, and I think the only thing better than a chocolate souffle is a cheese souffle. This is a must order! But keep in mind they only serve it at certain times like brunch and/or lunch possibly so call ahead to be sure.  Chef Jose really took the thinking out of everything. I didn't even have to look at the menu. I put my trust in him and he took us on a delicious journey of which I'll never forget. From a crab amuse bouche, to scallops served in fancy shells.  The restaurant group that owns Morels also owns Market City Caffe in Burbank, CA. I will always remember the time I went in to try their summer special and they served this incredibly fresh and delicious salad with fresh peaches. As soon as I mentioned that, they brought me two of their finest and yummiest salads on their menu. I mean, its salad and yet they make it so memorable!  For our main dish, we went with the Tomahawk. I'm not sure why I resort to this cut of steak, maybe because its big enough to feed 2 people. Maybe it's the marbling? Or maybe it's for the photo op with the bone :) Either way, it was quite the experience. This will be my #forevermood.  For the sides, we couldn't decide between the mac and cheese and the potatoes. So we went with both! The lobster mac and cheese was definitely more indulgent but both are perfect in their own right.  The staff is so very attentive. You will literally feel like you stepped in and became a celebrity overnight.  Although it was really hot when we went, they do have an outside patio that you might love because it is right in all the hubub on the strip. Great place to really treat yourself.

goWWXylgHqrYIh3Ib9Azmg.text: Deluxe experience -- small selection of food but deliver on quality. Good (and fun) drink selection, great ambiance. Recommend.

ungDJvCv8fjP0XHLROVM2A.text: Had breakfast with a friend the other day. I was greeted by a very sweet Asian Server named Chris. She told us about her favorite Morel  breakfast items & about the bottomless Mimosa. If i didn't have to go back to work, I definitely would have taken advantage of the mimosas.  She talked me into the Banana stuff French toast & suggested that I pair it with the organic Bacon. My friend got the American Breakfast with French pressed coffee. The French toast was spot on! And with the addition of bacon it balanced the sweet with savory. Which was what Chris said. She was delightful & a good conversationalist. Keeping our beverages filled. She also told us about the Dinner menu & we will definitely be back at a later date for that. I will ask for Chris as she is a great Server.

ZjqA4Po-fxw0kzXVCMyTSQ.text: I've been coming to Morel's since it first opened and with all that comes and goes in this town this restaurant is still striving for a good reason. I usually like dining on the outdoor patio, but it was a bit chilly on my last visit, so we sat inside. I made a reservation for a party of 10 and the restaurant had a nice table set for us to enjoy brunch. We were checked on often and the server was great about splitting checks.   I started out with some French Press Coffee that was enjoyable. The coffee would have paired great with the complimentary beignets sprinkled in a good amount of cinnamon and sugar that they brought to the table, but they were chewy and not hot. Bummer.   Onion Soup Gratinee ($10) - This soup shouldn't be passed up! It was cheesy and rich with flavor. Perfect way to start you meal or even a nice lunch on a cold day.   Banana and Mascarpone Stuffed French Toast ($16) - I'm so glad I ordered this because it was excellent! Others that tried some at my table loved it and said they would come back just for this. I'd have to agree. The outside of the french toast had this delicious crunch of cinnamon flavor. On the top was a decent amount of tasty bananas, the syrup was very good and the inside had the perfect amount of yummy filling. I also added a side of bacon for $6, I think it was 5 pieces, and it was thick and very good.  Imported Mushroom Souffle ($15) - Egg whites, morels, gruyere and sauce mornay with a side salad. Flowing high above the ramekin, this was one tasty dish. I'd definitely recommend the french toast and this dish for breakfast or brunch.   French Dip with Au Jus ($17) - Sliced prime rib, emmental cheese, caramelized onion and horseradish cream served with a side of fries. This is what my hubby ordered and he asked that the horseradish cream be left off which wasn't a problem. The sandwich could have been a smidge bigger, but wow that prime rib had such good flavor! Fries were also good.   Almost Famous Mac and Cheese ($10) - This was cheesy, creamy and the portion was big. Can't say I'd want this as my main meal, but it works as a shared side dish.   Baked Alaska - I'm not sure what this cost because my friend and fellow yelper, Jessica P. was thoughtful enough to treat our table to this dessert. I have to say it was comical when we all had our cameras ready for when this dessert was brought out and lit, but it was one failed attempt after another. Let me tell you a lot of rum was poured on the meringue before we finally had some flame action going on. The dessert was good, but there was definitely a strong taste of rum in each and every bite and while that usually shouldn't be a problem wanting more alcohol in certain things, it was a bit much on this dessert.   During brunch they have bottomless mimosas for $25 and a handcrafted "bloody" cart where for $17 you can have a Bloody Mary or Maria handcrafted table-side. Definitely a solid brunch, lunch or dinner spot. Morel's is located inside The Palazzo.

rgmj9tcX-w_KjyeNp8c8hg.text: Morels is one of my top favorite restaurants ever. The patio atmosphere is perfect. This is an amazing brunch or lunch spot. Upscale casual. And the food is DELICIOUS. The service is always good. And if you're a Bloody Mary fan, theirs is super good! I come back every time I visit Vegas almost!

hQc_P4dLcAgkClS7OIWJfQ.text: I love this place! If you are familiar with Mon Ami than this is similar ambiance without the crowd or long wait to sit on the patio. Now granted, you don't have the view of the spectacular Bellagio fountains, however, it's still Strip side and... NO WAIT! Amazing spot for breakfast or romantic dinner. Staff has always been great. I love that they make their Bloody Mary's from scratch and table side. Not to mention the bottomless mimosas option.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frites
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry banana crepe
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great views!

KZ4xh6GyJ5sMJoeCWPbI0Q.text: Hotess were super snobby. Made me feel uncomfortable right away. Kinda ruined my morning. It doesn't hurt to smile. Food was okay not great. Service started out nice until our server disappeared.

ZdvP-os4eTGj_TpmNcOU0Q.text: Convinced the family to try this place out once more. Maybe the taste has changed. Everyone wanted a steakhouse but didn't want to leave the property. Disappointed. Again. For a higher end steakhouse, find another place. I don't think we'll come back unless they up how they prepare their meats.   Sirloin- chewy. Bland. Can see why they offer rock salts of 3 kinds. Sauce that goes with the steak wasn't good but I needed some flavor to my steak.   Seafood pasta- seafood wasn't chewy. A bit bland also. But still good to eat.   Rib eye- chewy. Odd when it should be melting in your mouth.   Filet mignon- softer but bland also. Are we supposed to flavor our own meats? I don't like that idea.   Mac and cheese side- good but on the bland side.   Grilled asparagus- good!   Chicken strips and fries- for the kids- same as last time. Why is this the best thing we tasted? It was yummy!  Customer service- Our server was awesome! Very accommodating and knowledgeable about the menu ingredients. Him and his wait staff were all prompt and quick to respond to requests. I can come back if service is amazing and food was decent, but the food is just lacking in every way. At least they were very nice!!

bC3dryNqqANFMfUh4Y6lsg.text: Breakfast was pretty good here. They do a bloody Mary tableside and make it according to your tastes, mine was absolutely perfect. I got the Croque Madam, the dish itself was quite tasty (ham was a bit tasteless thus the 4 star rating) the cheese perfectly melted but the True star of the meal was my side of toast.. it was so perfectly done and the bread had such a nice texture and taste. Combine that with their homemade jam and butter it was amazing. A very good overall experience and waiter quite attentive.

tyWHAcES0Jg0CRAbG2DttQ.text: Good food, great service, my steak was amazing. We made a reservation for Friday March 1st, restaurant was half empty and reservation was not needed. I will come back considering Venetian is our favorite place to stay in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-nhfA6gY3Ls3tGOtKESrpQ.text: We had brunch and it was amazing! Brandon 's service was unparalleled and beyond expectations! Aside from the phenomenal service, the Salmon Benedict and French Toast were so on point, I had to write this review asap!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tr5jhjjkqamNzncOhKzZTw.text: Worst Venetian restaurant ever, do not go here unless you want bland, undercooked food with a management staff that could careless about you as a customer.  Just finished dinner 6/8, and disappointment was a key theme. We came here with a group of 6. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. Our waiter was super nice though, although service was a bit slow to start with.  Two of us Ordered 2 "specials" which were filet mignon Oscar style - medium rare. Inconsistency is in this kitchen's name. These guys don't even salt their protein!!! Aside from the fact that the outside of the steaks were over charred, almost to the point of burnt, one of the steaks was raw inside, while the other was just fine. The manager wouldn't even take it off the bill, he wouldn't even come out to talk to us about the bill. All he said was "I'm sorry for the sashimi, I'll have them cook it more thoroughly." To my surprise he had them cook the raw pieces rather than re-fire a steak from scratch. Needless to say that re-fired steak was not eaten, as it was over the desired doneness.  The hollandaise sauce that came with it, was metallic tasting, good thing they left it on the side, and it was all crusted over like it had been sitting there for a while.  I ordered the swordfish, it was cooked right, but was missing seasoning - can someone say 'salt and pepper'  The only good dish was the sea bass. It was cooked right, and the broth that it was in was delicious. We also had a creme brulee, and that was actually pretty good.  I didn't want to cause a scene with not having one of the filets taken off the bill, so we just left.  The picture of the steak looks better than it was (forgot to take a picture of the raw steak sliced horizontally).

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5HplDNeob0EjK1yQ3gwQVw.text: I had brunch at Morels on my most recent visit to Las Vegas and overall I would say that this restaurant is okay.  I ordered their granola and yogurt which was pretty good and their veggie omelette which I thought was fine, though a bit bland and nothing memorable.  It was hard for me to tell through pictures, but portions here are huge and big enough for two people to share.  Service was not spectacular - our server wasn't paying attention and ended up spilling water when she was filling our glasses.  She also was nowhere to be found when we were ready for our check.  Maybe the experience would have been a bit nicer had we sat outside; instead we were inside next to a couple of big and loud parties.  Morels is pretty convenient if you are staying at Palazzo; overall though, the experience was just okay and I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

wYsAla0ZcyDTf7I8fuE-5g.text: How can  start  dont know.We ordered appetizer it was very very salty we seI never ever eat that much oily pasta and we coudnt finish.Steak even not ok doesnt have any taste.For dessert we chose macaron we thought is is home made but t was not you can find better quality macaron in whole foods.

Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

afP_m6ir8jXM0dYt9aKlpA.text: Came here with a group of 8 for a birthday. The evening started out well but deteriorated over the few hours we were there.  Initially our server was attentive and friendly, but he lost interest in bothering with us and it became harder and harder to get his attention.  The other staff were excellent and helpful, but once the food began to arrive, it became clear that this place is more about the appearance of class and quality than the actual substance of it.  Our pasta was rich but rather flavourless, the fish was overcooked, and the fancy smoked salt they made such a fuss about ruined one of the steaks.  They did remove the steak from the bill and were very generous with birthday celebrations, but the food itself didn't sit especially well in our stomachs.   I might consider going back for a second chance if someone else really insisted it was good, but it overall seemed a lackluster experience.

Dqcb5E2krdXsPAlciCLjvA.text: At Morel's our favorite restaurant at the Palazzo. Here with the wife celebrating my birthday and Valentines Day.    This time we had the Seafood Fettuccine and the Alaskan Halibut.  The food was wonderful as usual.  The staff was great and very friendly also as usual.  Shout out to the manager Jerry K (who we missed this time) but we did get to see our favorite servers Nadia, Marina, and our new friend Mohammed.  For Valentines Day they have the wife a nice heart shaped balloon with a chocolate candy base.  For my birthday they gave me a nice Vanilla Creme Brulee that we shared for dessert.  A five star review as always.
