I decided to make the online reservation and get ready for an adventure. Palazzo is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the strip, and Morels is the perfect restaurant there. Its decor is sexy and chique, using black and white with hints of wine, and very sexy paintings on the main wall. As we entered the restaurant we were greeted by two lovely ladies who sat us indoors near the windows. Our server was more than helpful, and as usual I asked for suggestions for lunch. He brought out the dinner menu because their steaks are always available, and I went with their 100% Kansas raised bone in new york, medium. For starters we had a charcuterie of proscuitto and salami, complimented with 3 types of cheeses: a blue cheese blend of goat and sheep milk, as well as a brie and capricorn. It arrived with some walnut cake slices, fresh honey comb, walnut spread, as well as a mini baguette sliced to eat, grain mustard, mini pickles and pickled onions. All of it was savory, beautiful, and incredibly wonderful to eat. With the steaks we ordered mushrooms sauteed in truffle butter, along with pomme frites with an out of this world truffle mayonnaise made in house. All of the food was heavenly. First, the cured meat was freshly sliced nearby, and we watched the chef slice it deli thin along with the cheeses. He was meticulous with the plating despite it being a casual appetizer. The cheeses were fabulous. I am not a blue cheese person, but I will eat that blue cheese we ordered every single day if I could afford it. The honey comb along with the walnut cake was amazing, as was the other two cheeses we ordered. As for the steaks--I couldn't be happier. The carry over made the steak the perfect medium that I desired. With nothing but salt and black pepper to season, as well as a teaspoon of herb butter on top, it was thick, juicy, and worth every penny. The side dishes weren't just side dishes--they were meals in themselves! Mushrooms were just the right texture and seasoned well, and the pomme frites were the best I've had in Vegas. I love a good fry, but when you add a dipping sauce like a truffle mayo that they make, it's to die for. I wanted to smother it on everything. I could taste the hint of lemon zest and black pepper as well. It was fantastic. We ended the lunch with their signature souffle. I've had one before at Wolfgang Puck's, and it was fair. This, however, was incredible. Soft, fluffy and light as it should be, the dessert itself wasn't overpowering and because they used premium cocoa, the sweetness was well balanced. Their vanilla bean sauce was so good. I wanted to lick the plate when I was done. Overall, a great meal at under 200 dollars. Well worth the price tag. In Vegas, it's easy to spend a lot of money at a restaurant that serves mediocre food. Morels, however, is worth every penny. Make the trip. It's worth the time.

GpbBfOxUNWjuuykumKMJsQ.text: A typical Las Vegas spot with great service, excellent food and silly silly silly prices. The French press coffee was fantastic and highly addicting. I had scrambled eggs, hash browns, ham and OJ for 23$. For that price I think a floor show or at least a magician should have performed? The high quality food and service earns it four stars but if you can do without the decor and stylish casino vibe Denny's just down the street can save you $18 bucks.

UFEMJ5tgplRbJlGbraZbSA.text: This place has gone completely down hill over the past few years.  My meal here this past weekend will be the last time I ever dine here.  Went for lunch - the place was essentially empty.  We were a party of 4 - and 3 of the 4 orders either were incorrect, or were prepared incorrectly.  The service was friendly, but they did not compensate us in any way for wasting our time, and delivering such sub-par food.  Even after they tried to correct the meal, it was terrible.  Management never came over to see how we were doing.  Missing fries from my friends order literally took 30 minutes to prepare.  Food not only was prepared incorrectly, it just didn't taste very good.

v-P1LYLfNjSkZqCr-JjQZA.text: Brunch at Morels hit a high score with my family and I. We were seated in a half booth inside the restaurant. We ordered the following: - Salad Nicoise - Very tasty salad with seared ahi tuna, green beans, potato chunks, anchovies, quail egg (halved), olives, heirloom cherry tomatoes and tossed in a lovely vinaigrette - French Onion Soup - Now, that's what I call FOS! It comes in a small ceramic pot bubbling with the cheese melted over the bread on top of the oniony soup. Very delicate flavor and not at all salty. - Mushroom & Lentils Soup - Soup of the Day - soft lentils with mushrooms - dad liked it! - Mushrooms and Gruyere Crepes - 2 huge crepes smothered with creamy mushrooms. So delicious! - Short Rib Sandwich with green salad - very tasty short rib that you can cut with a fork! - Fish & Chips - Beautiful fish cooked in a light batter with home made yellow tartar sauce. Chips are thin strips of potato deep fried. Our order was a little slow in coming out after the soups came out. After waiting 25 minutes or so, our waiter finally reassured that our entrees were coming out. Most of the dishes that were leaving the kitchen were breakfast plates. Ours was more of lunch items. When we paid for our bill, I noticed that our tea for my mum had been comped! That was nice! Will definitely come back to Morels and taste what else they have to offer.

4hcWftXsgUns6YE1GebxVw.text: Morels is my favorite upscale restaurant in Vegas.  I eat here every time we come which averages 4-5 times a year.  Over the years I have sampled breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner.  Everything is delicious.  I would recommend that you visit the restaurant during brunch/happy hour when drinks are buy one get one free and sit at the bar.  The bar staff is excellent!

CFd4WNnKjKgbA9eKwvoRDw.text: Chose this place because they had rillette. Something that is dear and nostalgic to me. Went to order the item and was notified that they were not featuring the item. But yet it was on the menu.   Ordered the tuna tartare. It was very fishy. Something wasn't right. Had to send it back. Tuna should not be gray and should never taste fishy if being served raw.   Ordered the beef tartare. Much better. But again didn't seem fresh nor tasted fresh. Very sad and unhappy with both products.  Quail egg was laid to the side and presentation was atrocious.   Was then told the rillette was available which I got and was excited again. However, the rillette was bland dry and flat.   Overall I was very unhappy with the food. However the service was quite good. I would not recommend this place. Didn't seem like the kitchen had their ducks in a row.

aOa8VL0oo22yCr8-3_r7ow.text: There are a few things I expect from a nice Vegas dinner. Good food, beautiful ambiance, on point service, and high prices. The last one is not something I enjoy, but that's just how it is in Vegas. At Morel's, high prices was the only expectation of mine they met.   Let's start with ambiance: Nothing luxurious, fancy, or pretty about it. Boring.   Food: All average and pretty tasteless. Not worthy of the prices whatsoever. We were a party of 14 (3 of them being kids) and not one person liked their food. At a price tag of over $1500, that's a sucky way to start a Vegas trip. My salmon was dry and tough, the steaks undercooked and flavorless, and the sides extremely flavorless. Even the mac and cheese just tasted like pasta off the kids menu with some butter and Parmesan.   Service: A huge disappointment. The busboys were extremely attentive with refilling waters so there's a plus. The hostesses were straight up mean and were gossiping about us, in front of us. Um you're a restaurant not bouncers at a club. You should be pleasant. Our waiter was incredibly rude and just didn't seem to care at all. 2 seconds after I ordered my cocktail I decided I wanted wine. Annoying I know, but it was a quick change of heart. The waiter pretended to check with the bar and said they already made the drink. How do we know he pretended? We saw him!!! Not a huge deal, but lots of little things like that plus a rude attitude and it equals no beuno service.   Overall, not recommended. Much better out there.

mRP_M_k7GXr02wSrT7ro3A.text: We were there 6/29 for party of 7. First of all, the server was not too happy nor polite. He put his hands on my elder brother's shoulder like an "old friend". And we wait more than 20 minutes for the bread when he told us it's on the way. We order 6 special 4for $45 and pasta from kid's menu. When kid almost finish her pasta, they delivered 2 plates of 1st course. We asked aren't we suppose to have 6 of it. Their answer was they had combined them. We asked the manager  to show us how to put it back to 6 plates because they had only 2 pieces of each cheese on each plate and we have 6 people. Manager Jerry tried very "hard" and only sent 5 plates back and 1 of them was without meat.  We lost all appitize and ask Jerry's "permission" to cancel all orders  and left the place.  How can Palazzo allow such a low end service restaurant there? Never heard any French restaurant will "combine" first course without even let us know first.  There is a reason when everywhere else was full and there was not too many guest there.  It explained.

1eL5cbbmrpY7SKM_yDl99w.text: Overall not bad at all. Need a little improvement here and there.    Petit Plateau De Mer - 4 Shrimps, 6 Oysters, Octopus Ceviche, Dungeness Crab - FRESH. It's the seafood freshness that you can't describe. The octopus ceviche was very disappointing tho - didn't even touch it after tasting it.   Crab Oscar Benedict - served on a non-traditional bread, but wasn't bad. I almost prefer this bread instead of the traditional English muffin.   Mussels Marinire - Mussels, Garlic, Shallots, White Wine sauce, side of fries.  The fries soaked in white wine sauce with garlic and shallots made this dish.  However, the mussels were over cooked, the shells were broken and dried out, and the mussel were shriveled.  Since it was over cooked, the white wine boiled away leaving less sauce to enjoy.  So the best part of it, the sauce & fries, was short lived.  If they cooked it just right I'd come back for this dish.  Service - nothing spectacular. They didn't neglect you but they didn't go above and beyond.   I hate to give them 3 stars but it wasn't a solid 4 star restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite plateau de mar

A9AE-91VA7RF_oc9rT9Vug.text: We had $150 credit at The Palazzo so we used it towards Morels. I'm not a big fan of French food because I've had bouchon and mon ami gabi here in Vegas and both was really bad. No flavor and oily. I decided to give this place a shot with no expectations and it wasn't as bad as I thought.   I had lunch here with my boyfriend and his parents, so we ordered family style.   Nicoise Salad- first time ever trying a French salad and this was so good. The Nicoise salad had seared yellowfin and anchovies with quail egg dressed with summer vinaigrette. I was completely taken by surprise and it was way better than my Cobb Salad. 4/5  Flat iron steak & frites. Frites are fries, just a fancier way of saying it I guess. They were fried to crisp perfection and not too overdone. Steak was surprisingly good. Not the best but not bad coming from a French spot. It was a light season of a simple recipe of rosemary and salt and pepper with a nice tender. 4/5   Seafood Platter- west coast oysters, dungness crab claws, and humongous cocktail shrimp. Great appetizer if you're willing to dish out for it. Oysters were okay.. Not sweet as I expected since it's suppose to be. Other than that, everything else was delicious, even the Italian aioli they made in house for the crab was great. 4/5  Seared Scallops with Cous Cous- perfectly Sears scallops. Light white butter sauce. Not a fan of Cous Cous though. Scallops would've been good either by itself or accompanied with a greenie.  3.5/5  Seafood Fettuccini- light pasta dish. Clams, shrimp, mussel, garlic, and Chardonnay white sauce. My Boyfriend didn't like it because he likes creamy based sauce. This dish isn't meant to be like those heavy Italian dishes. Not bad but not omg good.  3/5   Cobb Salad- huge portion. Couldn't finish. But the dressing had WAY too much vinegar. 2/5   Overall this place was good. But if it weren't for the $150 Credit, i wouldn't come back because it's really expensive.

QCwJuoQ4B7AuVJC3XlfP3g.text: They may be a French steakhouse, but, today, we had a wonderful experience at brunch. Thank you for providing us some shelter from the noise and craziness of the brunch hour. Your service, food (crab omelet, American breakfast, Bloody Mary) were all perfectly executed and made our day.

3y5mMGQxy2seIV2Bxw1CUw.text: As soon as I landed in Vegas I had to grab something to eat . I decided to give this place a try since it's conveniently located where I was staying. The hostess sat us and our server promptly took our drink order.  Bottom less mimosas is $25 compared to $13 a glass. So why not? The server always made sure my glass was never empty. I didn't even need to find my server oncee! Kudos! For brunch I ordered a prosciutto and beet salad.  Something light but so satisfying! Everything was so fresh and the Beet added such a nice medley to the salad! Overall I had a great brunch and 1st meal in Vegas! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto and beet salad. Mimosas and fruit plate!

C7vAQIi_Dgs62wkXiSkB_Q.text: Rob at the bar was extremely rude when my wife didn't like the white wine that was terrible. Won't be back but thanks. We live in wine country so we know wine.

8Wt794Xdvpmr8ZOqK5KBrw.text: This restaurant is magnificent! Each time we're in Vegas, we eat bruch here & can't imagine going anywhere else!  The waiters, bartenders, managers, everyone here is so friendly & we have had nothing but a great experience every single time. We request Faustino as our waiter...He's great!! Order their specialty coffees...you WILL NOT regret it! Our last brunch here I ordered the banana fosters pancakes....O.M.G...you know it's good when the manager comes by & wants to take a pic of your food (not kidding, this happened). Tables beside us had food envy! Get it! Even if it means working out for 5 hours every single day for the next month...ORDER IT! The dungess crab Oscar Benedict is devine as well. We also had the Grand Plaateau de Mar for lunch one afternoon and it was outstanding as well!  Love this place & everyone here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Fosters pancakes &amp; crab oscar benedict

KKa0H8qyCciiIO-nps-PfA.text: Terrible, unbelievably slow service on a not-busy night.  Our waiter barely showed up throughout the meal; took forever to place our order and it went downhill from there.   Not sure why it went so wrong here. Food was mediocre at best.  Prices high given the quality of food, ambiance and lousy service. We waited so long for the check that I had to get up, walk all the way to the front desk, and ask for it...while the 3 young women at the front desk were talking amongst themselves, relatively uninterested in customer service as a concept. We won't be back.

LrMwcAXxIb1EBFsx5fKT1A.text: It just did not impress at all. For $140 bill for two I expected much better from a French restaurant.   The place was nearly empty on Sunday at 9pm. This should have meant better, more consistently attentive service, but no. It took a good 5 minutes for our server to show up with the menus. Take queue from Denny's and have the hostess give the menus to the clients - it works! Our server was ok, but I felt she did the bare minimum in checking on us and being friendly.   After a little while the attentiveness improved by the assistant waiter who would refill our beverages on time and without us asking.   Now on to the food. It was OK. Not bad but not great either. We had mussels and the halibut, and did not find either to be anything special or with some unique twist that would leave a lasting impression. The potato dauphinois side lacked seasoning, and was underwhelming.  The $37 dozen of oysters was fresh and delicious.   With so many restaurants in Vegas, having a restaurant with many mediocrities is a sure way for another more 'hungry' competitor to take over and wow the patrons.  Unfortunately for Morels, it needs improvement in consistency across many departments to stave off the hungry competitors. Otherwise we are sure to see some new eatery open in its place soon.

05jY86W0_DZag7ak8OdGfg.text: Amazing!!  Next time I am in Vegas I hope I can make it by to eat here . . . it was that good.  We had a lunch reservation, but it was not super crowded.  We took clients and were concerned with prices.  The service was attentive and the food was awesome.  I had the quiche and would get it again.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the lunch menu

RZitC8KayfmuubDUwZ0KNA.text: My husband and I ate here while staying at Palazzo. It had great reviews and I had heard of it before. The night we went in it was pretty empty, I just figured it was an off night. Our waitress was so friendly and personable. I ordered filet mignon and my husband got the lamb chops. Our food was average at best, I decided to order dessert as I had been looking forward to it all week. The Creme Brule with chocolate mousse was recommended to me. When it came out, it looked a lil funny but I took a bite anyways...it was sour! I quickly told my husband and as soon as he picked up my spoon he said he could smell that it had gone bad. I informed our server and she apologized. They removed the item from our check but I was surprised that I was served a spoiled dessert. I would not go back for the food, but service was wonderful

NL0D-OyFwnRN7mNcJL3YTA.text: I came here for breakfast for an alumni event. Let me tell you OH EM GEE it was SOOOOO good! I had the fruit plate with honey comb and vanilla yogurt. Then We had the French toast and egg Benedict on toast and ham AMAZING.  I'm still savoring how good that breakfast was as I am writing this review! Can't wait to go back again next time I'm in Vegas!!!!

5TRGjiFN9GAK2G7Mgiox5g.text: Service was slow, but the server was gracious and very polite.  I  had the quiche Lorraine and mezclun side salad.    The room was quiet and elegant, a truly fine restaurant for a romantic lunch for sure, but I was there on business.  The quiche was LOADED with caramelized onions...tasty, but just too much....a bit more cheese and ham would have been appreciated, and it was a fairly small piece.  My iced tea stayed filled pretty much the whole time.  The slow service and small portion size for a fairly expensive meal are cause for the three stars instead of four

Tz-8kq9r6oq_YdwzkYm9Sw.text: This was our first meal in Vegas and I am so glad it was.   My wife ordered the petite filet mignon (8 oz). Really nice char on it and a delicious pink. Really good piece of meat.   However it was the Bacon and Tomato risotto that totally won me over. I make risotto all the time at home (it's my thing if you will) and heaven knows I've had bad risottos at restaurants. I recognize it's hard to pull off in a restaurant setting. But that's what made the following so spectacular.  Let me just say this is one of the better risottos I've ever had. Sticky, smoky bacon, heirloom tomatoes that exploded like delicious firecrackers in your mouth and that finish of fresh basil was to die for. If I had one complaint it was that the fava beans almost seemed lost, but not enough to make me regret this dish at all.  Service was good. Good food and a relaxed atmosphere make this a good place to eat if you're in the mood for a steak or a delicious risotto (if they still have it).

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Roasted Tomato Risotto

6Qelxv13R-RjIU3g4pC6PA.text: This review is for the decor/service, the prosecco, and the fondue.   The decor of this place is gorgeous, and that brought it up to 3 stars. That and the service was pretty good.   My family came here for a quick fondue with some drinks before going to the pool or heading out to the strip. We LOVE fondue and were salivating at the idea of a fondue appetizer. We ordered it for three, and three proseccos.   The fondue was pretty bad. I mean, it was cheesy, but it tasted like a cheese sauce more than an authentic fondue. Even worse, the bread they gave us had NO crunch at all. It seemed like a white loaf that had been sitting there or not baked to a crisp.   We ran out of bread and asked for some different crispier bread, and he brought back baguette pieces. They looked great, but upon touching them I realized they were also soft. No crunch at all.   For 30 dollars for the fondue, it was a total let down. If you love fondue, please don't order this. I've had fondue in a lot of places, including Switzerland, and this is a joke of fondue.   Prosecco was good, service was good, and decor was good... But at a place like this, expensive ish food shouldn't be so 'meh'

_5eBd8PLDEf1xTExQldNiw.text: The tomahawk rib eye for two was perfect. Seasoned to perfection and came with rosemary potatoes. Also had the blue cheese iceberg salad and it was great as well. Loved their little dinner rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_Js4t5KY_829PBGPv89IQ.text: I came for lunch with my girlfriends after landing in Vegas. Service was horrible. It took forever to get seated they kept switching who was standing at the check-in. It took forever get water it took forever to get drinks it took forever to take our drink order, to order the food and we were so fed up at the end we walked inside to pay. The food was mediocre. The drinks didn't taste like they had any alcohol in them at all. We had to ask for ketchup when we all got burgers I mean come on. We saw tables near us had bread and they didn't even offer us.

U_mwQ5fXzMOEgCvxR4DxHg.text: Really recommend trying this place when in Vegas. About the same you would spend on one of the buffets on the strip however the food, the atmosphere and service is way better than you would get at a buffet.    Highlights of my meal:  CHEESE!!!!! OMG order somebody their specialty cheeses.  The come with bread and honeycomb and walnut preserves. To die for.  The tartare was out of this world and the watermelon salad fantastic. My salmon was cooked to perfection.  Quiet, refined, great and attentive service. Really a great find for the price. And if you get the summer tasting menu partner with a cheese course you will be stuffed, but deliciously so!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic salmon
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tartare. A must have.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese course

osIvpTlUqDkkL-L9Uai8nQ.text: I had lunch here and enjoyed it.  I liked the decor and the ambience.  They were playing some mood music with a beat which wasn't too loud.  I wanted a beet salad and tried their version with prosciutto.  While I was waiting for my salad, they provided me with their bread which was really good.  The rolls were served warm and had a thin skin with a nice, fluffy interior. The butter was soft as well and easily spread on the bread.  I had never had prosciutto with a beet salad but it worked really well.  There was a nice mix of flavors with the sharp taste of the blue cheese blending well with the savory prosciutto with the acidity of the balsamic dressing.  They also had some beans for texture which I think works really well with beet salads in general.  The golden beets were sweet and tasty, but they could have added more beets for color and balance.  My server was attentive and friendly and service was great overall.  The price was $21 including tip and was good value considering the quality here.  I will have to try the dinner options the next time I am around.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main dining area.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad with prosciutto.

AvQK_jWIzKugFBpObKjOEA.text: Was disappointed  waiter pushy tried to tell me what to order. Over priced food sub par  Decor was best part and the friends dinning with  Otherwise I would have given 1 star  Will not return and do not recommend  I had the ceviche lack of flavor was looking forward to the cilantro, lime , cucumber flavors just bland

UJ0frkwhmXn84sdNBL46kQ.text: Having twice visited Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro for Brunch, once long-prior to calling Las Vegas home, it was as a party of four that dinner was finally sat down to on Saturday, the Bar area hopping for a special Wine event while the grand dining room sat approximately half -full with a wide range of patrons.  Toqued by Chef JL Carrera and now the brand's flagship after deciding to opt-out of their lease at Hollywood's Grove, a recent menu overhaul adding some lighter choices to old favorites including plenty of Beef and Cheese, it was with reservations confirmed that guests were led to a rounded table at room's center, the wait-staff all well-dressed and professional as Water was filled while diners weighed the options.  Known best for their Fromagerie and Strip-facing patio, the weather unfortunately a touch too cold for the latter this evening, it was after a Cocktail order was placed that Bread arrived with Butter and Olive Puree, an Amuse Bouche quick to follow featuring Peaches and fresh Burrata drizzled in Vincotto.   Low-lit and modest in volume, nicely padded seats beneath high ceilings giving the space a "Big" Steakhouse feel while risque paintings add a certain charm, it was no more than fifteen minutes before space was cleared in anticipation of three Appetizers, a Martini glass of Ceviche pairing nicely to the Tequila-based Mentirosa while Tomato Soup with a touch of smoke and hidden Cheese ball was big enough to share, as was Morel's Classic Cheese Fondue that was ordered "for two" at $10 per person but large enough to serve four or more.  Mindful to not overdo it with melted Cheese, the fact that sliced Bread ran out with at least another quarter-cup remaining probably a blessing in disguise, it was with serviceware re-set that a brief wait preceded the arrival of entrees and sides, the whole table soon filled and most diners starting off their plates with sides including roasted Sprouts with salty Pork and Balsamic, extra cheesy Noodles dubbed "Macaroni" but not really and multi-layered Potatoes Dauphinois that would not have been out of place in a formal French Restaurant.  Not particularly sold on Onion Rings' $9 price tag, a cost of nearly two-dollars each unjustified by size or quality in compared to the national chains, it was thankfully Meat and Pasta that performed far better, the Short Rib presented sort of like Pot Roast and delicious save for a few spots overwhelmed by Bacon while handmade Rigatoni held up to meaty Bolognese and gooey puddles of Ricotta Cheese.  Unwilling to let any of the thinly pounded Pork go home in a doggy-bag, the bold flavor and crisp texture befitting an impressive presentation, it was only when seven Desserts arrived that the mistake was realized...though finding a bit of extra stomach space became easily justified by textbook Choux sandwiching Toasted Almond Ice Cream doused in thick Chocolate as well as housemade Macarons from which Coconut and Mocha were standouts.  Far from impressed by the Strawberry Crepe, an unannounced addition of Bananas doing no favors to the overly thick Pancake, it was fortunate that an Apple Crostada cooked crisp with Sugar stepped-up as did the yin-and-yang of Chocolate offered by airy Mousse and a dense Tart, the fact that Smoked Ricotta Ice Cream was sold out another bummer but made up for nicely by Cinnamon Frozen Yogurt that tastes a lot like Horchata.   FOUR STARS:  Easily overlooked on a property boasting three Steakhouses and a French Bistro boasting Thomas Keller's name Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro still has a lot of things going for it besides the Strip view, and with Chef Carrera now focusing on some lighter options the "something for everybody" space offers a lot of reasons to visit any time of day and with any sort of group.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Morels 11/10/18: Dinner Rolls, Olive Tapenade, Salted Butter
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Morels 11/10/18: Dinner Rolls, Olive Tapenade, Salted Butter
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Morels 11/10/18: Dinner Rolls, Olive Tapenade, Salted Butter

WdX6c_aWtO40Zx3NJpykRA.text: If you're looking for an A-OK place for lunch, especially if you're staying at the Venetian/Palazzo, I think Morels would be a great place to start.  Hubby and I ate here immediately after checking into our hotel.  Convenience was key as we were starving; luckily, the food was pretty good!  It was a Sunday and during brunch hours; however, we wanted lunch food.  I chose the turkey club sandwich, which had avocado and basil aioli.  A really nice flavor addition!   It was a very all sandwich and kind of hard to eat though.  Served with fries, which were also yummy.  Hubby chose the Steak Frites, and he said it was cooked perfectly.  Overall, good service, nice atmosphere.  It wasn't fancy, very casual.  We liked our meal very much.  Not our absolute favorite place in the Venetian/Palazzo area (that's reserved for Sushi Samba) but we enjoyed nonetheless.

a_sy1rWT7CHVjabEnNuV-A.text: Discovered Morels about two years ago. Have never been disappointed with the service or food. Desert menu is a must - start there -- amazing steaks. Rigatoni Bolognese is my favorite. They serve their dinner rolls with two unique 'butters'.  Stop by if your in Vegas, it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Bolognese

l5pZ7YJKuZ5roETXxtQu2A.text: Way too much money for poor quality. Great service. Lovely atmosphere and the lounge and ambience real comfortable but the food...  that's where they need to invest money into or maybe better chefs

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak scallops and potatoes

n5kNmuRXK-03CYvz5pYJTA.text: We sat in the lounge area for some happy hour cocktails and had excellent service while enjoying one of their comfy sofas. We also ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell. They were delicious - albeit $45 but hey it's Vegas baby.   The service was strong and the drinks were great. I've had dinner here in the past as well - great steakhouse fare.

OWP4oszjJqdNmfm5Cuk4pQ.text: This was our first meal after checking in for our long anticipated man trip. We were seated on the patio on a beautiful spring day for lunch. We waited a long time for a server to come and eventually went inside to find one. After this was sorted, we ordered cocktails which were fine, but the food had issues. They were slow in coming. Burger was way undercooked. Oysters came with soggy lemons which had obviously been sitting in a bucket. But the fried calamari was excellent, about as good as I have had.  Service was polite but slow. Patio is pretty but there is lots of traffic noise.

ZMbhA_O4CwzqSk8_YqDquQ.text: I definitely recommend making reservations here.  The place is very large, and the staff is experienced, but it fills up quickly (especially during big trade shows).  We loved our waitstaff, they were prompt and knowledgeable and kept the pace of our meal going at a comfortable rate.  The food is excellent here, I had the caprese salad and some others had the caesar. I would say that the portions are large, so you don't need appetizers and salads.  The entrees are plenty to eat on their own, so don't go crazy.  Our steaks were very good, especially the filet.  We had trouble with the temperature of a few of the entrees - 2 out of the 7 were not cooked correctly.  Our waiter fixed things promptly, and the rest of the meal continued without incident.  I enjoyed the filet, and it was just the right size.  Our desserts were quite good - we had 1 of each one and shared them among the table.  I liked the apple tart and ice cream the best.    Overall, this is a good place to take special guests or clients for dinner.  It's easy to get to, has plenty of seating and the food is good.  I thought it was a little loud and not a very intimate setting - so if you want romantic I would not go here.  I would eat here again if I had the chance.

M-o_oLPkczE1o66XOJdzjA.text: Alright, so the broiled ribeye was what you'd expect at a good steakhouse at this price. Way to go!  Other than that, our group of eight's experience here was a big joke.  The tablecloth didn't fool us that we were sitting at a folding table. Though the inter-lockable banquet hall chairs we sat in did match the shoddy table perfectly, so perhaps this was the work of a quirky interior designer?   After buying a bottle of wine, we only had to ask three separate times to get a refill. But they were so excited to refill at that point, they topped off one of our glasses with the wrong wine creating a new blend.  And after our first drink order there was never even a prompt for another round.  Refills of the "house water" were also tough to come by.   We ordered two sides of mushrooms and received one. After asking twice for another one...we never got it. Never fear...we still got charged for two of them.   The bathroom in the restaurant would also have been disappointing at an interstate Arby's.  I have never seen such an enthusiastic and coordinated lack of effort from an entire restaurant before (save for the broiler guy, of course). And on a $1k+ bill to boot. Absurd.

SzeGjlBjNZHNuYot1LoKAg.text: Disclaimer: I think I have a chronic disdain for French fine dining, and this is probably why I didn't like this restaurant. Every reason I wanted to run away screaming from the table is due to things customary to french dining.   For instance, I really hate feeling rushed while I eat. I'm not a fan of the servers hovering over my shoulder, waiting for to me to take the last bite from my plate before whisking away everything in front of me, and everything in my hand. I think it's pretty unnecessary and kind of rude.    Additionally, I didn't think the food was anything special. Actually, nobody at the table particularly enjoyed the food or service and we all agreed it was our least favorite dining experience in Vegas.  I will say, if you're looking for a quiet spot to enjoy an amazing cheese platter, have some wine, and have a nice view of the strip, I recommend you come here. Otherwise, there are way better restaurants like 50 meters away to enjoy a meal.

3Ur8RgMuGdFKRhDZiTxJIw.text: Morels exceeded our expectations!  This is a beautiful restaurant at the Palazzo. The sommelier set us up with a great Sonoma cabernet. I highly recommend starting with the cheese plate and request the Old Quebec 7 yr aged Cheddar.  All the food was amazing and the staff was top notch!   Looking forward to dining there again in the summer to sit on the patio overlooking the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Selection Cheese Plate

7qKcWm4drVlVXhE1DIXh0A.text: Disappointing. I had the chicken dish and it was decidedly ordinary, but the real problem here was the waiter. I told him I had a rather heavy lunch and wanted the crabmeat appetizer as my dinner entree. 'That won't be enough', he said, so instead I order that chicken dish which was WAY TOO BIG. He actually tried to pressure my date into an appetizer, saying that the salmon dish wasn't very large. WRONG. Thanks dude, next time engage your brain. Won't be back.

KGGZ1ulg_7evcVKINbGOTA.text: Received a breakfast credit here w/our stay at the Palazzo & were not disappointed!!!  I had the avocado toast throughout my stay & loved it!  My only suggestion is don't grill the sourdough, maybe a little darker toast.  The egg doesn't reach it enough to make it just the right amount of tenderness to cut.  While this doesn't sound like much of an issue, beware the person sitting across from you when you try to cut into it.  I hope they have great reflexes in the AM :)    I loved this so much that minus the bread actually coming from Bouchon I've learned to replicate this myself down to the oil & salt amounts that I like.  Banana strawberry crepe was tasty as well.  It's a standard crepe w/real cream whipped & some chocolate sauce.  If it's comp'ed or receiving a credit, be sure to tip the wait staff well.  We did & had the same server for 3 days & could not have been more thrilled.  Manuel was a delight & gave us wonderful suggestions of local Vegas things to do :)

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JUgUPfGWk10evLGMEF68EQ.text: Came here for brunch before we left Vegas.  The atmosphere is very classy and nice.  The space to sit in the booths are a bit cramped, so ask for a table instead, or maybe I'm just a bit too large for the space.  I gave this place a 4 star because the service was fantastic and the food was good.  The service was great, in that my water cup was constantly being refilled and almost rarely empty.  I did not know what to expect from a basic steak and eggs.  However I was a bit disappointed with how my food came out.  The steak was a bit dry.  And although the waitress confirmed with me that I wanted eggs over medium, they came out as eggs over easy.  I would have asked to exchange it, but we were on a time crunch.  The fries although have a large quantity, were all over done make it somewhat crunchy.  I don't mind the crunch but if you don't like it, this plate isn't for you.  If you do come here for brunch, I definitely would recommend some of their other breakfast items instead.  Apologies for the half-eaten ugly photo of the steak and eggs.  I was just starving that morning and wanted to eat right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half-Eaten Steak and Eggs w/ Fries.

LOQAf6eD9XpDNSqqY3wRgg.text: Here's how it goes. Find Irvine. He's the boy and will go out of his way to help you. Best waiter on the strip.

c1b3OA63WvacQIIUpMmvvQ.text: We went for brunch today. We've been here before in the past. My wife loves their mushroom souffle, but it isn't available for Sunday brunch. The cocktails...it's 5 o'clock somewhere, and it's Vegas baby!...were good. Staff was nice, and attentive.   My wife ordered then Oscar Benedict, I had the traditional Benedict. Their Hollandaise sauce is quite good, the eggs were cooked perfectly, but... They replace the traditional English muffin with a slice of brioche toast. Which is not a good thing. I remembered the bread had been an issue in the past, after I cut into it. Their brioche is always very crumbly, but ours today seemed more stale than usual. It was like eating a Benedict on a bed of dry bread crumbs. If they'll let you sub a real English muffin, I highly recommend the Benedict. If not, pass for something else.  We'll be back, but today was not a good day for Morels.

7fP3Z049glZC64NOtrEwjg.text: Had a good but not great brunch at Morels on a Saturday.  We had a group of 9 and were seated at a large circular table near the window facing the Strip.  Service was very strong throughout the meal.    You start with gratis toast, strawberry jam, and butter.  The jam is legit.  It's housemade and it was fantastic.  Were I to return I would definitely get a couple of slices of toast again.  I went with the chicken and waffles and also tried some scrambled eggs and potatoes off of another plate.  I also had a glass of orange juice which was very good.  Way better than I was expecting.  Clearly fresh squeezed and chilled.  Best OJ I've had in a long time.  The chicken and waffles comes with a lot of chicken.  I gave a couple of pieces away and still had plenty.  The waffle is nice and crispy but it's dry.  It sucked up the syrup like a sponge, I had to ask for another serving.  It's a good waffle, I had better on our trip, but it was good.  The chicken is crispy but needed seasoning.  I enjoyed this dish enough to order it again, but I imagine were I to return to Morels I would try something else, because the chicken and waffles weren't so good that I MUST get them again.  The eggs and potatoes were decent but had issues.  The eggs were scrambled too hard, they were fairly overcooked.  Also, my brother ordered the eggs with cheddar cheese, and all they did was lay a piece of cheddar on top rather than scrambling it with the cheese.  I am guessing this is why they were overcooked, they cooked the entire thing under the salamander to get the cheese melted after they had already scrambled the eggs.  The potatoes weren't seasoned in any way I could discern.  Once you added salt and pepper they were okay, but this was another disappointment.  We had a great lunch, I was catching up with old friends from my time living in Vegas.  They kept refilling our bottomless mimosas ($25) and did not rush us at all even though the meal had been over for around an hour.  Very hospitable.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles.

8t-SdxTTyCEtQE40I7b5nw.text: "...covered in hollandaise with Dungeness crab and asparagus"  I'm sorry, what did you just say?  "Today's special is either an 8 or 14 oz bone in filet...covered in hollandaise with Dungeness crab and asparagus"  That was how my experience at Morels started...and yes, I went with the special.  The person to my right? An oven roasted whole main lobster covered in? You guessed it, Dungeness crab...  The tables appetizers? A seafood platter, and??? A Dungeness crab salad...  I'm not sure what lobsters and Dungeness crabs ever did to the executive chef; but he's getting his revenge, one satisfied table at a time.

87qdQxxf2pspuXkVk-_rng.text: Don't waste your calories or your hard earned money here. Food was AWFUL, lamb and ribeyes were over cooked and super bland, absolutely NO taste.  The 2* is for the appetizers and the side dishes.    Group of 7, we ordered 3 ribeyes medium rare, 1 lamb, 1 Halibut, 1 porkchop with Brussel sprouts and potato, steamed mussels and calamari with complimentary bread.  The ONLY thing we liked was the warm bread with butter.   1. Ribeyes were overcooked with no taste 2. Lamb overcooked, we sent it back 3. Halibut was overcooked and fishy 4. Porkchop was way too dry and chewy  We won't be back!!!

Djp_JUlkBJoNgGMKV7EKBg.text: Came here for the second time and this place is pretty awesome! I had the Huevo Ranchero and I loved it! I recommend this dish to anyone who's looking for a satisfying but not too heavy breakfast or brunch. Another thing I loved from this place was their jam. The jam they have here is hands down the best! Its a must when you're in Vegas! The staff are all very friendly, they really make sure you feel welcomed and comfortable when you're in the restaurant. Last would be the macarons, also something people gotta try! Thanks for the awesome experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wDFcOqPV0wmqPOa9_RsnNA.text: Went to Vegas for a spontaneous trip.  Actually, we decided to have one of those 10-10-10 weddings.  Stayed at the Palazzo and just wanted to try any nearby restaurant.  The hubby and I came here two days in a row, once for lunch and once for breakfast.  We enjoyed everything about this restaurant, well, except for the hostess that greeted us. She wasn't rude, but she wasn't friendly either (both days that we visited!).  She seemed very annoyed with us when we were trying to decide where to sit (the place was quite empty and so we had a large choice of tables both indoors and outdoors to choose from).  For lunch, we had the classic cheese fondue ($20 & mmm mmm), pork and veal meatloaf ($17), and quiche lorraine ($15).  All were very tasty and had a great presentation (too bad I didn't have my camera).  And for dessert, we had the trio creme brulee (3 mini cups of  vanilla, almond, and pistachio and 2 mini cookies to dip in them...all 3 flavors were mmm mmm mmm) along with a latte and Rwandan coffee.  For next day's breakfast, we had the seasonal fruit ($11), french toast ($14), and the free range egg crab omelette ($17) along with a latte and Rwandan coffee.  All were tasty, but nothing to go crazy for.  Both times, the wait staff and service were superb. We received quick service from friendly and conversational waiters.  Our water glasses were never half full.  All the waiters seemed to look after each other's tables when the others were busy.  The place is nice and classy-looking.  The restrooms were clean too.  They have a large assortment of wine on the wall and a variety of cheese to choose from also.  If we ever go back to Vegas, we'll probably visit here again.

jCK5Pvmx88cXhCUPRvMWsQ.text: We spontaneously decided to grab dinner here and weren't sorry. The steaks we had were cooked perfectly. The service was very friendly. The only thing keeping me from giving it five stars is that the waiter said that the souffle was not being offered anymore since over a year which makes me wonder what it is still doing on the menu....

Iy6nYz9X_xTit4GdLzODzg.text: We were in Vegas in business and needed a place to get a decent meal before continuing work. The server was very polite and courteous but I found the food disappointing and extremely overpriced. I had the chicken with spinach. The chicken was supposed to have been marinated for 24 hours - couldn't taste that. And the spinach was primarily salty. My colleague had pasta bolognese. The dish was grey and looked dull. No colors at all. And the taste was just like would they serve you at Denny's or another fast food joint. I know that location is everything but then that is what you're paying for.

wNIBbwOBWBX2TqYfS-gBAg.text: Amazing.  One of the best steaks I've ever had.  The Caesar salad made table side is always a nice touch.  Great service as well!

czvlUwSwrUDQOKMlEIxHyQ.text: Brunch was good, BUT...  They should take down the pictures of pancakes they advertise all over the Palazzo if they only serve them for breakfast Monday through Friday! Those pancakes look amazing, and you will not find them here for weekend brunch. Mind you, the french toast is really good, but still...  Sausage is AWFUL, not sure what is going on there. Orange juice does not taste fresh squeezed, which I'd expect from a place like this. Hmmm.  Overall, though, good enough, just not great - bolstered by views and surroundings.

91u0aIJK2GszEOwSWacNEw.text: I absolutely would recommend Morels to anyone wanting SUPERB service and delicious food.    My sister, mother and I had lunch here last week.  Service was prompt, engaging and most of all knowledgeable.  Any question we had regarding wine or food selection they could answer in detail.  I love that. The food was fresh and yummy.  I loved getting the same quality service for lunch as I would at an upscale steakhouse for dinner.    Ask for Stephano as your server.  You will not be disappointed he.  His helpful attitude, humor and knowledge really added to our meal experience.  Can't wait to go back.

_5YZxKepGcHy5GJ-UiwfGg.text: Surprisingly Good Brunch for Vegetarians! My husband and I were in Vegas for Memorial Fay weekend, went to try Bouchon for Brunch and they closed at 2:00... Kinda early for Vegas on a holiday weekend if you stayed up late a Saturday night! Anyway, off we went to find something new...and we ran into Morels! So glad we did! I had a decaf French Press Coffee and hubby had regular ($5.00 - all you can drink for that great price) so delicious.  They start you off with a roll and butter and French music overhead (French Country, the French rock-n-roll, then French Traditional...you get the picture).  We had toast with butter and raspberry jam ($2.50) didn't need it - too much food by end of meal but it was tasty.  I had the Veggie omelet, it comes with mixed greens or potatoes, stick with the greens. Lighter, tasty and hubby had the potatoes - nothing to write hone about. Save the calories for something else. The omelet was around ($15).  My husband had the Chiliquiles with potatoes, around the same price as my omelet - I did not keep my receipt but it was around $50 for lunch.  I enjoyed it, everyone around seemed to be as well. You can dine outdoors, we dined in, too warm that day.

J75zOtdeGQPBAEjlV4Q_bg.text: Four stars for the steak! I had a bone-in RIbeye with some eggs for bfast. FANTASTIC. My wife had the huevos rancheros and that was not very good at all. Very bland. Come here for steaks and nothings else and you will be okay. =)

jeFoIYOlpB5ieCRlHM61tA.text: Morels is a hidden gem with fantastic food and views in The Palazzo. The lady and I stumbled across it and were rewarded for our adventurous nature. The fondue is superb and very reasonably priced. We splurged for seared fois gras and it was on par with the best we've had in Paris. The outdoor patio is breezy and has a fantastic view of the Strip. On top of great food and views, the service was the best we've ever experienced and we have had our fair share of top-priced dinners. The sommelier Alex B. was particularly fantastic both providing some fantastic pairings and going above and beyond actually repairing my better half's recently cracked souvenir glass with super glue (yes, I'm serious). Really above and beyond experience and I'm hoping they expand Morels to Miami soon.

u-1d0IOD83SnlkqgQ5Oxzg.text: We had an awesome experience here.  Had dinner here, cheese selection was yummy, and the filet was so tasty.  Chocolate martinis were fantastic.

qVLg1Iea1wTPP-QO_XHljw.text: Shared a caesars salad, the kind where they make it at the table.  Dressing was too tangy to the point I couldn't eat it.  They asked us if we wanted each ingredient so if we said yes to all the ingredients the dressing should be good.  Others ate their salad but did say it was tangy.  For $17 a person, I would expect a better dressing.  The seafood fettuccine was pretty good.  Shrimp could have been a little softer but the other seafood was cooked perfect.  The location where we sat and the time of day had sunlight shining on us so we were resat.  Then they opened the curtains which made it too bright again.  They eventually closed the curtains.  They should not have even tried to sit anyone at those sunny tables.  They don't have any window coverings to help the situation for those few tables.  Bad restaurant design.

E4fmJ5c5UVJdb63LxnN4gw.text: This is one of the few restaurants with outdoors seating + view of the strip. We came here for brunch and requested an outdoor seating. You could see the beautiful garden of Palazzo, the Trump tower, Fashion Show mall, & Treasure Island. This area is much serene than Paris' Mon Ami Gabi. The food was above average, staff was very personable and attentive. Definitely a great way to start the day!

4B8HJu3RRthw3B6Rwj7E7A.text: Dungeoness Crab eggs benedict.  Eggs on top of a bed of crab meat sitting on top of breading.  The egg yolk just melted all around the crab and breading below which tasted okay.  The citrus hollandaise sauce was a good complement.

ffJKX0QPIHniQWqGzAt3jg.text: Overall our experience yesterday was excellent.  Our waitstaff and food were top notch.  The cheese fondue was perfectly made.  I ordered the prime , 35 day aged new york strip and it was perfectly prepared at medium rare.  If the weather is nice I recommend sitting outside.  You have a view of TI (and their show).  Highly recommended.

jIo2btzosP60kewCZBWEvQ.text: Excellent food and guest service. Waiters are conversationalists and food is beyond compare.

vNMtjsVts69GFCOTV-vjAQ.text: Located in the Palazzo hotel, this place is nice with business casual dress code.  Shorts with a button shirt is acceptable.  This place has a lot of naked paintings which makes dining interesting.  They even have their own restrooms, so you don't need to go into a casino.  The food was very good.  The caesar salad is made table side which is a plus for me.  I had  the braised short rib.  Very moist, tender and rich with fat.  The only negative was the desserts were meh.  You expect them to be top notch in a French joint.  Overall... I thought it was a good meal.  I would definitely come back.

jzxo4Nlk76_4z3RNz6BvcQ.text: My initial instinct was surprise at a 3.5 star rating for Morels.  What?  And although I have a hard time identifying reasons as to why Morels is super awesome, it sits well in my memory.  I've tried 50% of the menu by now, and in total I have to say that it's good dining.  The couple of items I didn't like were the salmon flatbread and the thick toast (too thick) under the eggs benedict.  They have a lovely selection of shellfish and cheeses! And the bread and butter is good.  And there's a very good olive tapenade.  I could just eat bite after bite of those...

dY3DECPy48ATjXfYSjlURw.text: I absolutely LOVED this place!!!   Our waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful.  The bottle of wine we had was delicious.  The chicken pallaird I ordered on a bed of spinach was absolutely mouth watering.  To finish the meal, I ordered the creme brulee dessert.  It should have been shared with others but we each had ordered our own dessert.  The pistachio cream brulee out of the three was my favorite!

RZMQm9Yd2QBGSTXzqyxd3w.text: Lunch is delicious... Seafood pasta is not bad at all... The best part is they have reverse happy hour from 12:00 pm to 6:00 pm

Q6hRIswXsfYAAIYGaqke7Q.text: This place is great. Great atmosphere, great food and an Amazing sommelier Alex(complete with cool French accent). My favorites were the Steak Heirloom Tomato salad, the fried prawns and frites, and the cheeses(huge variety to many to name). Lunch on the patio was my favorite.

8TPlgHekJ4OtSJHP7thNQg.text: Located next to what can be an outrageously long check-in line at the Palazzo, Morels steak house definitely commands the "Las Vegas Premium." The food is -okay-, but the decor and views definitely feel right in place at a hotel as grand as the Palazzo.   I went to Morel's at around 11:30am on Sunday after checkout. There wasn't too much of a crowd, and we were able to get seated right away. The waitress seemed pretty uninformed on the menu, and she flat out didn't know about the 4 course summer special advertised at the entrance of the restaurant.   I ended up ordering a fish and chips, and the food was not bad. The fish was over-fried and a bit tasteless, but good with some S&P and the home-made tartar sauce. The quantity of food was definitely more than I expected.  Overall decent to stop at if you're passing by, are hungry, and have $30 to shove into slightly-above-average food.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips!

gSjKlgw6DsKh19LVglxPtg.text: We came here for breakfast, I had the mushroom crepe and my husband had the turkey hash. While he enjoyed his meal, I thought the crepe was underseasoned and the sauce had a weird texture. The service was slow and uninspired. I might come here again as I thought the ambiance was nice, but definitely not for breakfast.

Jnx-a46Y0XJj-8CBsvuAig.text: I'm in love with this place! The service is always amazing and the oysters are to die for!! I went by myself and sat at the indoor bar. I was craving one of their perfect Martini's and their small sweet succulent oysters. Everything was absolutely amazing. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish!!

ClgV6ztgHFVOvC-ltvU-YA.text: Quick Look: Quality restaurant w/ some flaws that need to be addressed by management. One of the best raw seafood bar's in the city.   In Depth Review: We are local Las Vegas foodies and enjoy the fine restaurants in this city on a regular basis. Had Morel's on my list for a long time. Finally had a chance to experience it on a Thursday night in April of 2015. It was my ladies birthday and we wanted Oysters/Shell-Fish. We found Morel's by doing some research online. We made a reservation for 8:30pm. Requested a private booth. When we arrived the booths were full and we were advised to grab a drink at the bar. We were OK with that.   Here is where we ran into major issue #1 -   Went to the bar and ordered two Hendrinks gin and tonics w/ lime.  We were informed they were out of Hendrinks (and all top shelf gins). We thought the barkeep was joking. He informed us that they had a private event a few nights earlier, said they were gin drinkers & cleared them out. Shocked by this response as I know that most quality Vegas establishments will restock quickly after such an event. In addition, they can always borrow from another bar/restaurant they have a relationship with inside the hotel. Finally, they can borrow from the massive inventory the hotel keeps on hand at all times.   The bartender was named Brandon and he was very nice and friendly. He made some great suggestions for alternative drinks. We were bummed that we could not enjoy some quality gin drinks with our food, but he made us feel better about the situation. In addition, he poured us some complimentary birthday glasses of Champagne in honor of my wife's birthday. Classy touch. He's a great asset to this restaurant.   After a 20 minute wait past our reservation time we were brought to our booth. The restaurant was 60% filled. It was a clean and nice room. Great sight-lines, minimalistic decor (typical French restaurant). Only advice would be to turn the lights down a few notches, it was too bright in the room to create an intimate atmosphere.   Our server identified himself and was super attentive. He knew the menu inside and out and made some killer recommendations.   We ordered the "PETIT PLATEAU DE MER," which translate into petite platter of seafood. It consisted of 4 Shrimp, 6 Oysters, Octopus Ceviche &  1/2 Dungeness Crab. The cost was $60. Well worth it for the freshness we received. It was delicious. I will go out on a limb and say this was one of the freshest raw seafood platters in Vegas. I highly suggest you order this if you go to Morels.  For our appetizer we ordered "CHEF'S PRIME BEEF TENDERLOIN TARTARE." It consisted of Quail Egg, Truffled & Potato Chips. It was unique. I could taste some fancy homemade ketchup in the mix. My wife though it had a Chipotle flavor. The server confirmed that they do indeed use a homemade ketchup and mustard when preparing it. It was wet and sticky in texture, not your typical beef tartare. With that said, we enjoyed it.   For our entrees we ordered the Colorado Rack of Lamb ($52) and the 18 Hour Braised Short Rib ($37). As a side we ordered the steamed asparagus ($10). The short rib entree was decent. The meat was a bit dry and over cooked. I have tasted better, for far less money. I did enjoy the fresh bacon pieces on the plate. The Colorado rack of Lamb was good. My wife mentioned it was in the same category as the rack of lamb at every other god restaurant in the city. But at $52 it was higher priced than than those other restaurants. You would expect to have a superior cut and plate at that price point. The asparagus was as expected, tasted good. Think both entrees were also good, just not amazing.   Here is another area of opportunity for the management to improve upon. Clean up and fix your confusing wine list. It was on white printed computer paper, hole punched and put in a cheap binder. The first three pages were dirty and had been torn from the rings of the binder. The wine list was almost impossible to read. Not sure who designed this, or who approved it's use? It's not a quality look at all. I will attach some pics so you can address it. We were ordering $20+ glasses of wine from a menu that looked like something you would find at the local diner.   We ordered the ice cream as a desert. It was a delicious ending. They put a candle in the desert for her birthday. Nice touch.   In summary: We spent almost $400 for a birthday dinner experience at a fine dining restaurant. The service was fantastic. The raw shell fish platter was superb. Unfortunately the entrees were mediocre. The wine list confusing. The bar not fully stocked. Not the 5 star experience we had hoped / paid for. Few tweaks and Morel's can be a top contender.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Seafood Platter - Delicious, Fresh Shell Fish. YUMMY!!
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Cream Desert w/ Birthday Candle
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Decor (Near Bathrooms)

FXnF4MUCP2JkqO_dlzNCZg.text: Amazing quiche!  I want to take a moment to focus on the quiche Lorraine here......................AMAZING  It's buttery, salty from the bacon, sweet from the caramelized onions, flaky and so damn great. No joke the best I've had in this city. I've also lived in Paris many years ago and I fondly remember gaining 20 pounds in just six months over quiche Lorraine there!   The restaurant is beautiful with a bistro feel that has very sexy art all over the place and our waitress was kind enough to give me a few postcards with the artists info who is Tom Cannon. The art is perfect and they also have a beautiful outdoor space that overlooks Las Vegas Blvd.   The food is really great here and did I mention they have quiche Lorraine? Ok let's get through this and the highlights without losing my focus. The tuna tartare was fresh and light. The cheese fondue was decadent and fun to dip & eat. The crab omelet my friends ordered was fluffy and delicious and my quiche was out of this world. I remember every bite...:)  We also received complimentary dessert which was a pleasant surprise. Thank you for the delicious profiteroles with warm chocolate sauce!   The service was on point and we came over on a weekday for a business lunch and luckily had the place to ourselves. This however worried me because this place should be popular.   I have had dinner at this location before but we didn't have a fantastic experience due to waiting too long even with reservations but this lunch experience was perfect.

gO7qsnKlOUnd0hNXu6Rlug.text: Pleasantly surprised.  Some of the reviews were less than flattering, but my party of eight was very happy.  - Easy to find - Excellent service - Nice space, not too loud - The charcuterie board was above average, but not excellent.  Good cheeses, especially the mimolette.  The cured meats were pretty standard - The beef tartare was average by itself, but combined with Morels' homemade ruffles, it was excellent - The steak (prime rib eye) was very nicely aged.  Nice and meaty, tender, full of flavor.  I tasted the beef rather than salt and butter, which was refreshing in a high end steakhouse

LXNEj9WgmpWeEdbpD04wxg.text: Let's put it this way: we like this place so much we ate here twice during our last trip. With all the restaurants to choose from in town, that should say something!  We've eaten breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner here on various trips and have never had a bad meal. The waitstaff is also excellent. Attentive, accurate and if you get Tito or Sal, funny as well!  Some general notes: Breakfast - skip the Bloody Mary cart unless you have a special request. The bartender can crank one out that is just as good in half the time. This last trip I tried the Turkey Hash - diced turkey, potatoes, sliced jalapenos, grilled brussels sprouts topped with a sunny side up egg, served in a sizzling hot cast iron pan. To die for! The wife's fruit plate had excellent selections of perfectly ripe fruit and melon. The omelets are huge and stuffed with all sorts of goodness.  Lunch - Good burgers, good steaks, great service.  Dinner - If you get the chance, try the Tasting Menu when it's offered. The steak tartare is quite possibly the best I've ever had. The steaks are great, the short rib transcendent. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  We were bummed when Society Cafe closed next door at Encore, but Morel's more than makes up for that loss. Excellent bar and good wine selection as well.

ZRCMnaURv7RhKaBVfSmDdA.text: I came here Sunday 6/12 with a girlfriend for brunch during Restaurant Week. I love Restaurant Week because you get to enjoy good food and it's for a good cause. A portion of all proceeds goes to help the Three Square food bank in Southern Nevada. She made a reservation online using Open Table for 11am. Morels is located in the Grand Lobby at the Palazzo, right next to the hotel check in and Lavo. We arrived promptly for our reso and it was found right away. We asked to sit outside on the patio and we were seated at a table in the shade.   The Restaurant Week menu included a 3 course meal of either breakfast or lunch. Dinner is also available later in the evening. My friend and I opted to do both breakfast and lunch and share everything. The first courses were seasonal fruit and yogurt and a Greek salad. We got to pick our mains and we chose steak frites and classic eggs benedict. And for dessert we got vanilla creme brulee and a strawberry crepe. I also ordered an orange juice, and she was supposed to receive French pressed coffee as it came with the breakfast, but it wasn't until we were well into our second course that we had to flag someone down to bring us the coffee. My friend also said she would have probably ordered a bloody mary from the cart they had, but was never offered. That is the only gripe I have to say about Morel's is the service was lacking.   Food wise, everything was delicious. The seasonal fruit was fresh and paired nicely with the vanilla yogurt. The Greek salad was like a wedge salad with tons of olives, feta, and tomatoes dressed in a light vinaigrette. The steak frites was an 8oz piece of skirt steak and fries. The steak was cooked perfectly medium as we requested. The fries although plain were quite tasty. I dipped them in some ketchup. I enjoyed the classic benedict, which was 2 poached eggs, country ham and a generous amount of hollandaise atop a thick piece of brioche bread. Last but not least, dessert. The vanilla creme brulee was fantastic. I loved breaking into the sugary shell and indulging in the smooth vanilla egg custard underneath. I could have eaten the whole thing, but I had a delicious strawberry crepe waiting for me. The crepe was light and airy, filled with a lovely whipped cream and then topped with strawberries, bananas, and chocolate sauce. For both of us we spent around $32 with tax and tip which is not bad when brunching on the strip. We both agreed that we would definitely come back to Morel's.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and strawberry crepe
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French press coffee

qDxGsEzYYRX7hQFBpWLzzw.text: Our server, Jerry, was tremendous. He was extremely polite, knowledgeable, and attentive. I wish I remembered the name of the gentleman who was working with him, because he was also fantastic.   I had the Pesto Chicken with fingerling potatoes. The chicken was flavored perfectly, succulent, and looked as good as it tasted.  The macaroni and cheese with lobster was underwhelming to the point of not being good. I would recommend staying away from that.  My husband had the salmon with lentils and that was very good.   My dad had the rigatoni bolognese which was also underwhelming. There was nothing wrong with it per se, but it did not stand out as something we would have again.  Overall, we enjoyed our dinner, but not enough to justify the price.

2pMsBfLSk3Fbb2zrkl9aOQ.text: I'm sure this has been covered extensively in other reviews, but interesting choice of artwork they have going on here. Keeps you occupied for a good handful of minutes while tilting your head and wondering whose which what body parts are depicted. We came for a birthday brunch and I was pretty happy with my king crab eggs benedict. The oysters were fine as well. The biggest complaint was the bloody mary; apparently the "non spicy" ones were still too spicy to chug down for most of the group. Overall, it's a decent brunch spot, especially if your group is staying at the Venetian or Palazzo and are far too hungover to crawl very far. They also made the birthday girl give a giddy shriek with a really cute sparkler candle on top of a delicious creme brulee, so they get some bonus points there!

p8xUUNs3x5sqo5KDxvzKVQ.text: Food was excellent. Oysters were great, steaks were cooked perfectly, short ribs were tender and tasty. Sal & Sabino were great waiters. The sommelier Kevin was excellent. Even the hostess was extremely helpful with her recommendations...a gem of a first impression that really sold us on the restaurant. So glad we listened!

B6tWyY2MsWCenPBy7Ive7Q.text: We made our 2nd visit ever to Morels this weekend, and Morels solidified it's place in my top 5 LV Strip restaurants.  The weather was wonderful, so we perched on the patio, which is great for taking in the views and people, but elevated and set behind a fountain to protect your experience from the strip commotion.  The service was exceptional.  Quality is where Morels excels over many strip competitors.  Every item offered is consistently of the highest quality, and crafted with precision.   I love their massive cheese list, offering many cheeses from all over the world.  The cheese menu is well organized by cow, goat, and sheep milk; then it is sorted by texture.  The meat and rillette (pate) selection is considerably smaller, but all high quality items with detailed descriptions.  Next time I want to order the Scottish Salmon rillette.  The charcuterie presentation includes tags on each cheese with the name, description, and region.  We ordered the 3 cheese, 3 meat board, which also showed up with the most delicious honeycomb and fig preserves.  Our 3 cheeses:  1.  Mimolette Extra Vielle - Nord-Pas-de Calais, France (Firm Cow's milk) - salty and a little nutty, once banned by the FDA  2.  Valencay Pyramide - Loire Valley, France (Semi soft Goat's milk) - mellow and savory, one of Napoleon's favorite cheeses  3.  Idiazabel - Navarra/Basque, Spain (Firm Sheep's milk) - buttery, nutty, smokey; pairs well with salami and cured meats

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing Fromage (cheese) list
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie selections

OwcJTCLI_C3aUt39cJXVdA.text: Well Morels was recommended by a close friends for a night cap and dessert to end my birthday adventure.  And was not disappointed!  The manager (mark) was super helpful and professional in helping recommend some good dessert to end the night with.   We ended up going with the classic profiteroles, and the traditional creme brulee.  Not too sweet, perfectly homemade dessert dishes (and a sparkler to boot for my birthday).  Our bartender (Julie) was also very pleasant and knowledgeable.  I tried their infused bourbon, Red Rider b.b. Which is one of the signature drinks here and it was very good, just a little heavy with dessert.  So she recommended an Aperitief style cocktail with bullied bourbon that was amazing.  Highly recommended restaurant!
