Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The French pressed
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing display, French pressed coffee

muqbQY9UiTHNeEx93aEeAA.text: We just done eating a steak here, which was good, I've told them that I'm not eating dairy and asked to not add butter to my steak and order as a side the asparagus which I ask specifically without dairy which means no butter and no cheese.  The asparagus came with cheese on top.  They apologized, after letting me know that in the order it came with dairy alergy and still was served with cheese and of course the manager said: someone could have been die... I'm sorry...  Be aware. We are not going to eat here again!

lZXD0gcRDZY0-41MZvDxVQ.text: Went for lunch at an off-peak (2pm or so) time. About a third through my steak, which was medium rare-rare, I found what looked to be a numbered tag or label - similar to what you would get if you ordered food and had to wait - at the bottom of my dish, drenched in steak jus and all. They were decent enough to waive the bill, offered to replace my meal, and asked if there was anything they could offer me to drink, but by that point I'd lost all appetite and just wanted to get out of there.   Seater, server and manager all seemed nice, but perhaps the kitchen needs to match up to the exterior.

UYl2ab_ufSMan0-n0dWsuw.text: We chose Morel's for dinner with a client - my boss had been for lunch before and said it was great.  For appetizers, we shared the Tuna Tartare and the Heirloom Tomato and Burrata Salad, both were fantastic. For an entree my boss and I shared the Brick Chicken (we have a favorite restaurant back home in Colorado that makes something similar so naturally, we wanted to try it). It was different but very good and in addition to the appetizers we had already gotten, sharing one was perfectly sized. Our guest got the Surf & Turf (filet mignon and lobster tail) which was JUST as good at it sounds! We also shared a side of green beans; they were tasty but I will say that $11 for a less-than-generously portioned side of green beans is outrageous. Their sommalier suggested a phenomenal bottle of pinot noir that paired well with everything.  We ended the evening with the Trio of Creme Brulees - they were great! Overall, the atmosphere was very nice, the service was good (the junior server in our case was more attentive than our primary server - maybe that's why they had both!), and the food was excellent. I would recommend Morel's to anyone and would love to return next time I'm in Las Vegas.

iLxfSdIw5Mkkll331-UACw.text: A great place to go to, we were there during the summer and before heading out to the pool parties we stopped by and had food and drinks.  Jerry was wonderful and we are planning on going back soon.  The food here isn't crazy expensive but it is very good.  A must do

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FzFx_Ib3mp9SwJM3kkr-Ag.text: If you are in Vegas, Morels is the only restaurant with consistently great service and food. They kept my tummy happy this trip! The service has been phenomenal. I have been jet lagged and a bit "blah" during my business trip. Everyone I have encountered has been outstanding. When I travel, I try to go to different places. I tried several restaurants during my stay. Mostly I have been disappointed by the degradation of service and/or food at these 3-5 star establishments. Morels has been my go-to for a pick me up meal. Tonight is my last night and I felt tired and sad from leaving my family. I was treated to an empathetic staff and a wonderful steak. Little things go a long way. Will keep this as my regular place when I am in town. Much appreciated!

ivsy8kpwDKiIM5C4lyShbg.text: First time trying this restaurant. Food was excellent only to be trumped by the service which was better.  Oscar was outstanding!!!

dvprVOlbrQ_P8bRPEjcPnA.text: We tried this restaurant on our first night out in Vegas. We are staying at the Palazzo so we imagined it to be incredible since the hotel is. The calamari was good but portion was small. We Ordered table-side ceases salad. The server had us taste the dressing he prepared and appeared to be irritated when we asked to add additional Parmesan as it tasted a lot like vinegar. When we ordered our dinner, one of the guests asked to have calamari be brought out with the salad and he said "um, I'll try".  My husband and I got the Tomahak steak to share (about $150 a couple). I was not impressed with the taste of the steak). The service was not good. I was not impressed. I came to this restaurant because I read other reviews and thought it would be good. I would NOT recommend!

PdJArUNFPGoSdJbApoKOXg.text: There is so much to do in Vegas and it can be so overwhelming. So I suggest that you just go to Morels in the Venetian!  The brunch is awesome (crab eggs benedict) but the "bottomless mimosas" and the bloody mary cart are killer.  Its makes for a wonderful morning. Irwin (our brunch host) and Jared (our host at lunch) were simply amazing making this a fun experience - so many laughs. Best  brunch ever!!!!

fbMsE0pUUBWZ47W0Qb0zPQ.text: This place is expensive, I don't care what anyone tells you, so let me get that out of the way first.  I don't know where to begin. The waitstaff was incredible. Friendly, attentive, and with an amazing command of the menu, both food and liquor wise.  Next, the sommelier, Alex, was not only knowledgeable, but friendly and funny. I enjoyed him immensely, as well as the wine suggestion he gave us.  We started with a cheese plate. We picked our five, and I'm not sure you could go wrong with any of the cheeses they offer. I'm a big bleu fan, and they did not disappoint.  Our main course was the "surf and turf for two" which is just the lobster and a steak of your choosing split for you. It was amazing (you're not saving any money though, it's still charged as two entrees.)  For dessert we had the cremates brulee' trio. I'm a huge creme brulee fan and this hit the mark like you wouldn't believe.  I highly recommend this place, just be prepared that it's not a cheap meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our entrees
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée Trio
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged NY Strip

nmHyl9PTd0V3LhCkR2JkIg.text: This place was frankly horrible in food quality and ironically great in service. My friends and I dropped by for a lunch while we were in Vegas for the weekend, but we did not expect this place to be so horrible.  They first gave us complimentary Beignets that were disgusting! They were dry and tasteless. And why were they not dusted with powdered sugar? They were covered in table sugar and cinnamon, which waa a horrible idea.  I got some sort of Turkey Avocado sandwich. It tasted okay, nothing to write home about, however, the bread was very hard to bite through. It was rock hard. I do not enjoy struggling this hard to eat my food. The salad also looked as if it had lost life on the plate, overdressed and limp.  My boyfriend ordered a Croque Madame I believe. It tasted better than most things we ordered, but the fries that came with his ordered were empty and lifeless. They was no crunch, no seasoning, no flavor! How do you mess up fries?  One strange item was the toast that was given to us. It had a slightly chewy texture, but it ended up being crumbly and breaking down into dust. I was in awe of this strange toast...  The saving grace of all this disastrous food was the service. We were constantly offered water, checked up on it, and treated with kindness.  Long story short, I will never come back here. Lesson learned.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of Aug 2019 part 2
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horrible dry beignets dusted with crusty sugar..
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Avocado was okay. Bread was rock hard and very difficult to eat. Salad looked like it died.

y7sc5cgjItRSM_ZOA2csEw.text: SKIP AT ALL COSTS!   I came here with 3 of my friends and not one of us had a positive thing to say. Overpriced, overcooked, bad service... the list goes on but allow me to elaborate. We came here after seeing the very impressive Summer Tasting Menu on social media. 4 plates for $47.50 and opted to do the wine pairing flight for the additional $20.  1st impression: BEAUTIFUL spot! Gorgeous decor but empty on a Tuesday night. Sure Tuesdays are typically not indicative of a busy restaurant but you would at least expect half the restaurant full. I would say there were 4 tables occupied including ours. Our waiter came quickly and went through all of the specials not giving us a second to say anything. After about 3 minutes of him telling us the specials, we informed him that we wanted to do the tasting menu and he seemed disappointed in the choice, he said "Really? Are you sure? Do you know about our tasting menu?" he proceeded to say that the portions are extremely small but we said that was fine and wanted it anyway. We got two rolls of bread each and what looked like a tube squirted piece of butter that was really good enough for about one roll. Why are we being so cheap with the bread and butter?  I ordered the Chef's Prime Beef Tenderloin Tartare, the Sunsweet Watermelon and Arugula Salad, the Grass Fed New York Sirloin and the Chocolate Mousse.   Chef's Prime Beef Tenderloin Tartare: I would rate the dish a 5/10. It was well seasoned but in traditional tartare, there is a quail egg on the dish. It was also advertised to have a quail egg on the dish but somehow it never made it to the plate. It was also served with TWO potato chips. TWO! It was a small dish but it needed more than two chips.  Watermelon and Arugula Salad: I would rate the dish an 8/10. Really delicious and refreshing but how can you screw up a salad? This was the best thing we were served with the biggest portion. I enjoyed it very much.  Grass Fed New York Sirloin: I would rate the dish a 4/10. Extremely tough meat and it was thick like a filet mignon, not what you want when you order a New York steak. Came with mashed potatoes and they were literally that. Imagine mashing potatoes and serving them without seasoning or garlic, cheese, cream ANYTHING. Gritty and nasty. The only rescuing factor was the vegetables that came with it.  Chocolate Mousse: So good! 10/10 The only thing worth eating here.  Other things to mention, between each course, we waited about 10-15 minutes. We would get a wine for our next course and it would be sitting there for 10-15 minutes waiting for our next dish to be served. My friend ordered the calamari as her first course and she didn't even eat it. She said she couldn't chew through it. Another friend had to give back a glass of wine because the glass was dirty... come on... rookie mistakes here.  This was the worst $70 meal I have ever had and it would just be best to advise you all, if you're thinking of coming here, to just not.

5-vize9GDh7-_EmgmsNN_g.text: All the dishes here are amazing! Everything came out very good. I really my lobster. It was cook perfectly. Very juicy! The favorite was of the lobster was to die for. Very nice  and romantic place. For dessert we were very disappointed with the crepe. It was pre made. It taste like I'm eating paper with whip creams. Don't waste your money on that.

EBWDixCC1X3_nYR2zoO7PA.text: We wanted to like Morels at the Palazzo but the Vegas.com pre-Fixe three course dinner was lacking on a Tuesday evening. We were the second party in the entire beautiful dining room and by the time we left 90 minutes later there were still only a handful of diners at 6:30 PM. Our server and her assistant were both friendly and the meal was served pretty fast as she asked if our group was on any time limitations for a show (we were and appreciated her asking). Our first course Caesar Salad was tasty and ample. Our main course choices (salmon and chicken) were presented nicely ... the chicken was moist and served in a larger than expected portion. The salmon was fine but I would likely try something else next time (I don't care to have my fish served with its oily and fatty skin still on it) and not try to be so "healthy". Our third course for dessert were profiteroles but these were served simply as two cream puffs ... I only ate the whipped ice cream filling because the puffs were stale. I would not suggest the Vegas.com pre-pay dinner package ... you don't get any choice on your first course appetizer or your third course dessert, the second course main choices are limited to three: chicken, fish or beef, and drinks and gratuity are extra charge. The dining room manager was great when we returned after our show after realizing the Vegas.com package excluded gratuity. No mention was made by the staff about this fact (as they try to be "discreet" about it) leaving the customer unclear as to what dollar amount to base the gratuity on and leaving no bill holder in the table to imply a gratuity should be left in it. So we initially walked out not understanding this and short changing our friendly waitress and her assistant. We corrected this afterwards, but it required us having to walk all the way back to Morels to rectify the situation. Many other customers would likely not bother to do this.

bbSHxcbQkeixxwRv7hRarA.text: First time eating here, ambience was wonderful. Service was quick and professional. Our waiter Jerry was absolutely wonderful. You could tell he really enjoyed his job and really loved people and service. The food was absolutely fantastic. Pasta is made in house and was wonderful, cooked perfectly! Flavors were on point! Will definitely be coming back!

eFgOMlulzue8_XNw3UVRdw.text: When it comes to location, it doesn't get much better than the Palazzo, which is right between the Wynn and the Venetian. This extravagant setting is the perfect lure for the masses of locals and tourists walking the strip, and as we approach the hotel, anticipation begins to mount for the experience ahead.  Morels theme is French-American cuisine with a heavy emphasis on quality steaks, a large selection of raw seafood, hot seafood, cheeses, charcuterie, and award winning list of wine. From first impressions, to flavorful food and great hospitality. Unlike many fine dining establishments, this steakhouse is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner with brunch offered on Saturdays and Sundays.  Lunch offers various soups, salads and other small appetizers, the mid-day menu features a variety of burgers and sandwiches served with a salad or a side of pommes frites. Lunch also introduces a diverse collection of main courses as well as an esteemed iced seafood selection with six premium offerings including fresh oysters and two well-designed seafood samplers.  If you're walking the strip, the entrance to Morels is quite convenient, just steps from the large glass doors leading in to the Palazzo. The bar itself, like much of the interior architecture, is built of dark wood stretching upward, nearly reaching the ceiling. There is an impressive collection of vodkas, gin, scotch, whiskey, tequila, rum and cognac.  The dining room is really spacious. The booths look out across the open room and offer a view of all the happenings within the restaurant as well as a direct line-of-sight through the numerous window-paneled doors that lead to the outside patio. The Marie room is large enough to accommodate up to 50 guests comfortably, and the Louis room, perhaps the more desirable of the two because of the large window and natural lighting, has enough space for up to 40.  The charcuterie boards include freshly sliced bread and each individual piece of cheese is garnished with a small paper label with the name of the cheese, the type of milk used to create it and the country the cheese is from.  The Caesar Salad is prepared table-side. First, fresh squeezed lemon juice, then we add home-made sour cream, a little bit of Dijon mustard, next garlic, a tiny bit of anchovies, some mayonnaise instead of the more traditional raw egg, and then finished off with a bit of Worcestershire sauce, red wine vinegar, plenty of olive oil, and fresh grated parmesan. The salad is crisp and full of different flavors.   The tuna tartare is great quality with avocado, peppers, cilantro, pine nuts and sesame oil, all on top of a delicate fried truffle gafete, reminiscent of a very fancy potato chip. The buttery avocado is perfect with the rich, salty tuna and offers a creamy consistency to each bite that complements the crunch of the pine nuts and the lingering truffle aftertaste of the gafete.  Next comes the 32-ounce Porterhouse (carved tableside), Sauteed Green Beans in Foie Gras Butter, Potato Dauphinois, Artichoke Au Morels, and the Chef's Country Mac & Cheese, along with individual helpings of seafood fettucine, showcasing Manila clams, mussels, shrimp and lobster with tomato concassee, garlic and white wine.  The all natural, 28-day aged beef, grilled under a 1200 degree broiler and served with a house-made bordelaise sauce and Morel mushroom sauce. In addition to new cutlery, a server also lays out a long rectangular dish which holds another Morels specialty. He explains that what we see before us are three rare salts recommended specifically for the enhancement of steak flavor. There was Alder wood-smoked Black Sea salt, Pink Sea Salt from the Philippines, and Pink Himalayan salt (the rarest of the three). Each adds a unique twist to the meat, and I particularly favor the charred, roasted smoke flavor of the Black Sea salt. I slice through a large piece of the filet really like how well the outer layer has been seared, hiding the perfect medium rare interior. The rib eye is thick, and is effortless to cut through. This piece is all about extra flavor, with a beautiful marbling of fatty tissues. The bordelaise and Morel mushroom sauce offer a rich addition to an already well-rounded set of flavors and the Black Sea salt is a nice addition.  The Country Mac & Cheese is thick and creamy. Beneath the crispy bread crumb topping, a balanced combination of cured ham and noodles are engulfed in a gourmet sauce of parmesan, blue, Ementhal and Gruyere cheeses. The Artichokes Au Morel are tender and provide a noticeable kick of fresh garlic, and the green beans receive an extra flavor boost from fresh shallots, garlic and a sprits of lemon juice. In a close second to the Country Mac & Cheese, the Potato Dauphinois is a cross between potatoes au gratin and a classic baked potato, served fresh from the oven with roasted garlic and cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PRIME, Midwestern corn fed, dry aged 35 days RIB EYE STEAK 14 oz.

Yp-SSzX3iprn8FMy6BEu3Q.text: The fact that places like this exist kind of blow my mind... in a bad way.  We came for lunch and had the mushroom souffle, a Greek salad, fries with truffle mayonnaise, and an omelet. Both souffle and omelet came with side green salads. Our meal, with coffee and tip cost just under one hundred dollars.   The souffle was dry, chewy, and we really could not taste the supposed star of the show -- the mushroom. The Gruyere cheese sauce it was served with not properly emulsified and so it was full of oil pockets.    The Fries with truffle mayonnaise should never have been served to any customer.  The fries were cold and slightly stale. The mayonnaise had heavily oxidized to the point of forming translucent crusty curdy edges. It clearly was left out in its serving boat for several hours before it made its way to my plate to get this way. If this was a house made mayo with raw egg it it would not have been safe to eat. This is a serious lack in quality control.   The Greek salad was quartered Romain lettuce cores that were over bitter and not fully coated with the dressing. Covered with cubes of feta, much smaller cubes of cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes and olives.  While the "toppings" were not bad the presentation was disjointed and this can't-mess-it-up dish was only partially edible.   The side green salads were made with wilted, bitter, old greens. The way the spring mix greens get after sitting in a refrigerator for a week after purchase. Again this should never have made it to a customer's plate.   The quality of the food at the price paid was so low that there really is no point to considering service in this review.

ELTY1HOSnT57pbjjCZJzlQ.text: Went there for a dinner with a team of 9 people. It was a mid week early evening but the service was very slow. It took us 3 hours to complete the dinner and leave. I was starving when we arrived there, so the slow service didn't help. Also, I'm used to get a bread basket at the beginning of the meal, so even if you have to wait a long time for your meal, you can at least eat some of the bread and be good. Oh, I was wrong here. We did not get any bread until the first course arrived. So weird.  For the starter, we went with Grand Seafood Platter. The presentation was very nice, didn't had a chance to try all items, but the scallops and shrimp ceviche were very good.  For the main, I got the lobster pasta and it was delicious. They serve it in an empty lobster shell, and the portion was very generous. Also, a lot of lobster and scallops. I think that was the best dinner plate from all we got, the rest of my companions got steaks and they were not happy either with the quality of meat, taste and the proper cooking. I tried some of the table sides, everything was just ok. I was so glad I went with pasta.   Overall, very pricey place for not necessarily the best food options. Especially considering that this should be a steakhouse, and it ends up that nobody was satisfied with steaks, and the best part of the meal was seafood.

qDOWEkBarQZWGdpruOSHZg.text: I think that Morels is pretty much one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. We make a beeline for it every time and this time enjoyed it twice - both times loving the fact that we could sit on their large outdoor patio and watch the would go by with a killer view of the strip.  A few notes on Morels - the service is always impeccable, perhaps the best on the Strip. As an example when we asked if kids could sit in the lounge they declined but the manager came out to apologize when there was no need as we were fine but it is an example of them always going above and beyond.   They have the best cheese selection and it's always super fresh. They also have delicious seafood, steaks and a great brunch with bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's made table-side to your preference. They are also known for an excellent and comprehensive wine selection.  This visit we tried them for brunch and lunch - we had amazing oysters which were fresh and well prepared, a cheese and meat board, the fries ( delicious by the way ) and on a later visit crab Benedict with a spicy Bloody Mary. On this visit they comped us free desserts from the holiday menu - pumpkin pie and pecan pie which were the best we had ever tasted.  The service was amazing and it was so much fun sitting out enjoying the great weather with great food. Cannot wait to go back!!

7zqWYbCDAO12UcuYAvVitA.text: This restaurant was very clean with attentive wait staff but it was over priced. We ordered a side of roasted mushrooms and they were way over-cooked, kind of difficult to chew, felt rubbery. They'll charge you $65 or more for a single piece of steak, without a salad or side. If you want a side you have to pay extra for it, like $12 or more. I will say, besides the mushrooms, the food was tasty. I really liked the filet mignon I ordered. Cooked just the way I asked and full of flavor.

Fa6BLgzLNdMisM6UMFFmDA.text: So far this is the best fish and chips I've ever encountered in Las Vegas. Forget the Gordon Ramsay crap this is the real deal at Morels. The fish is Sole and it was completely grease free, light, and tasty. It was served with an excellent herbed tartar sauce. The portion was huge and who makes better fries than a French bistro? The giant Wild Alaskan caught Prawns were delicious. It was too hot to use the magnificent patio, so staying in and admiring the soft core porn on the walls was a fine substitute. Morels is at Palazzo or Venalazzo.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhDq9UUddqmOhAI9iRl25A.text: I went to Morels with my work company for a trip I won. I love steakhouses and who doesn't. Morels did not disappoint.  We had a set menu for a private event so I can't speak to the whole menu. I can speak to what we ate and the amazing service we were provided.  For appetizer we had the option of Vegetable soup or steak tartare. I am not breathe enough for raw meat so I had the soup with low expectations. The broth was so fresh and tasted homemade. What an amazing soup.  I then chose the wedge salad which was totally refreshing.   My main entree was the salmon. I really love to order fish at steak restaurants as it is often an unsung hero and underrated. It was between that or the filet. I find filet overrated as it has such a low fat content. I made a great choice as the wheat berries paired nicely.  Lastly, I chose chocolate mousse as the desert and I thought this would be a mousse cake. It was not and did not have a lot of flavor. Not enough to ruin the night.  Our servers were incredibly attentive. If you are in Vegas, make a stop here. I highly recommend.

LvRkZ-hcvGP80LSCW-l5Jw.text: This had one of the best NY Strip Steaks I ever had. That was enough for me to give it the 5 stars. Just on that. That's how good it is.  We got a starter with sea food, and it was good. My beef was with the ceviche. It's not the ceviche I know and love (the Mexican kind.) Everything else on that starter was top notch. They also give you a beet salad, but I didn't think much about it.  Service was good. It's hard to complain when they have those guys with the pepper grinders. That's how you know you're in the big leagues.  Depending on where you sit, you might get lucky like me and get an epic view of the strip. I got to see a guy dressed as a raggedy Pikachu dancing in the corner. An amazing experience.

63vdTwo0Nf0WjZjPGkHaoA.text: Beautiful location and the service was ok, but we found the food to be not so great.  The caesar salad was bland and boring and our steaks seemed warmed instead of cooked...we asked for medium rare and the fat was not even rendered out of them.  A bit too much to pay for steak that is not premium.

3Fl0C-VvMxIjLVok6xHM9w.text: Just because you got a free meal you have to sweeten up the review a little, nope that's not me or who I am. This was my first time eating at Morels French Steakhouse located in the Palazzo & Venetian Casino and this would be my last. The menu looks very promising being upscale and all but when you actually ate some of the food it was a big disappointment. I ordered take out for my disappointing dinner and had the following   French fries 2/5 if you were to have steaks fries it might have been better or the Great Greeks fries is way better  Freshly made tater tots 1/5 ok they were made fresh and??? Lacks a lot of things   Rigatoni Bolognese 3/5 the pasta was kinda chewy and nothing really stood out  Bone in ribeye 20 0Z 2/5 hmmm I'm not sure if it's 20 0Z but it was over cooked when i asked for med well   Loaded baked potatoes 2/5 wow even this one was super meh I took one bite and threw it away   Cold press organic juice 2/5 nothing stood out even regular Jamba Juice is way better   It's a shame for a higher end restaurant with higher price tag the food was not on the same level as other competition. So far the best steak I've ever ate was at Ruth Chris, the Ranch in Anaheim. Please go back to the drawing board or choose new cooks and make something stand out.

Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good but lack of passion and taste

t_zuZzMIO9Ma7JWrpMIoKg.text: Casual lounge. Nice small plates for sharing. Intimate and quiet lounge.  We visited on happy hour as the signs enticed us in to the nice bar/lounge area. Service was great but somehow the waitress failed to give us the happy hour discounts as advertised and we never noticed until we got back to our room afterwards. So instead of a happy hour deal it was more of a happy hour bait n switch scam.   But luckily the food was very good and of exceptional quality. I loved the steak tartar and the bruchetta was some of the best i have ever had. The side of mac n cheese was glorious after a day at the beach club and it totally hit the spot and satisfied our hunger pangs. Get the mac and cheese. Its worth it and you wont regret it. Our drinks were mixed well and had a good ratio of liquor and juice. Overall the quality was worth the full price but we were not happy about not receiving the happy hour special despite asking about it when ordering.   Ps. You must check out the dining room. They have a great wine cellar perfect for photos and super cool to see! Dont miss it on your way to the washroom
