At least there's value at an applebees. I must say the steak I had there was in the top 5 of all time. The True flavor was that of steak humans use to get in the 80's. They do give you an assortment of salts to flavor your steak. Some places over salt to enhance the bland flavor of their meat. I am very Leary of eating seafood in vegas and never in summertime when minimum wage workers leave products on loading docks, but their oysters were as fresh tasing as I've had in seafood resorts. This place is great. Oh be sure to get the dauphin potatoes so good

fXQwIFjL7W6-bpihpuDy4w.text: Was in Vegas for the weekend with the family. We stayed at the Palazzo and I decided on taking my parents out to a nice dinner. We didn't really need to look far at other high end restaurants as Morel's and another steak house was in the hotel. Morel's didn't have high reviews but I based my decision on the posted Yelp pictures.   I made a reservation through Open Table but didn't really need make a reservation for Saturday night dinner on the long Memorial Day weekend (it wasn't that packed).   Experience and atmosphere was nice. Patio seating is available that overlooks Las Vegas Blvd and Treasure Island/Wynn/the mall (corner view). The service was awesome and the food was delicious. We had steaks, pasta and the raw oysters. A plus was that Morel's had a children's menu!! SCORE! You seldom have children's menus at high end places, this helped out as I had my young son with me. Raw oysters ($20 for 1/2 dozen) was super fresh and tasty. My "prime" rib eye Bordelaise was good ($66) but a bit over cooked, I asked for medium rare and it was almost medium. Mom's linguini clams was good, the pasta sauce was perfect for dipping the bread and Morel's added tons of clam.   Overall a good dinner with my parents, we all enjoyed Morel's and I would recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeses.
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Party of 4.5.

sCcd2C91axH9pzKZl6OuBA.text: Booked for brunch due to proximity to our hotel location. Requested outside, hostess said no because of threat of rain - which never occurred. Enjoyed the food, but the ambience was lacking - too bright and just felt like I was in a hotel breakfast bar.

7XdXZkazVFQ5PFDL6eicPA.text: If you consider the awesome service, location, atmosphere, excellent food, and then factor in the price and value, you have to say fantastic. The overall ratings here are way too low on here.

ksLgjf2TgQuuxrl3e2IRbw.text: One of the few brunch spots, in the strip, that I frequently visit. We prefer to sit outside since their is a nice balcony to people watch the strip.   The menu is extensive with something for everyone from vegan options to filet mignon. I usually order a steak or their chicken and waffles which are both amazing. Although the steak could've had a bit more seasoning this time, the service is always exquisite enough to come back for.  The Serbian waitress we had was attentive despite having a table of 20 plus to service as well. The table had asked for more umbrellas for shade and she moved 6 all by herself. It speaks to the level of dedication she has for her tables since not one of her coworkers came by to assist much to our dismay.  She kept the drinks coming and had our water cups always filled. After being away for 6 months, it was the perfect brunch to come home to.

IhRDE1X5HPpFS44qaVzxrg.text: Simply a perfect evening with tremendous customer service.   Food was a 10*  .......when even the water is spectacular you know its gonna be a great night.  Outside view was intoxicating.  I cant wait to return.  The manager Paolo was icing on the cake.   Great man who made everyone feel special

Fchq-Ts7-_rTaXQQfNGodQ.text: Worst meal I've ever had. Sad to say. We ordered the salmon and lentils. Lentils were super salty and the salmon had zero seasoning or any flavor at all. Way too expensive for a less than impressive meal. The calamari was also super spicy with red pepper flakes. Disappointed.

3TblV5X4x7ijzKy92Sje2Q.text: This was a very subpar experience and the food was mediocre at best. We had a party of 14 in a nearly empty restaurant and still had to ask for the bread which I ended up regretting. Hardly the crispy french baguette I was looking forward to.  The overall table feedback was that the steaks were unenthusiastic, the pasta was of the Olive Garden variety and the fish was an absolute no go zone. At $25 for a glass of house Cabernet, spend the extra and go to Cut. Cone on Chipper, you can do better than this...!!

QpMxxnqiDM9eDfs9lysQFQ.text: Extremely disappointed. The NY strip at $62 was mediocre at best. Very dry and bland. Charred on the outside while pink on the inside. I only ate half. Tried to liven it up with bernaise, but that too was subpar. Only ate half the steak. Server never even bothered to ask if it was okay. Same with the French onion soup which I had been craving since I saw it on the menu online. Lousy with no flavor, in a French restaurant no less?! My friend had the rib eye which he liked ok, but just tasted excessively salty to me. That was $64. The Brussels sprouts with balsamic reduction was a fraction of the quality I've gotten at much less expensive restaurants. Just had no taste. The server was nice enough but overly aggressive (tried to sell my 9 year old a $120 lobster - thank god I asked the price before we finalized the order). Overall, a bad experience, and I'll never go back. Shame that we wasted what could have been a wonderful meal at any number of fine restaurants in this hotel on Morel's.

gkHKA71cq224-hxksaH6MA.text: I swear I've reviewed this place before!  Shame on me!  This is my hands down, favorite place for Breakfast/Brunch in Vegas.  I will come here from across the whole strip if I have to.  Between ambiance (sitting outside on the patio), to the impeccable service I always receive, to the food deliciousness, I would give this place 6 stars if I could.  I get the Croque Madam with Frites, pretty much every time I come here and it has never disappointed.  Melt in your mouth buttery bread, delicious Mornay(sp?) sauce and a beautifully fried egg on top. *drool*  I've come with someone new every time so far and always begged for a taste of their food so I can make sure Morels is not just a one hit wonder.  So far so good, everything I've had is delicious.  This time around, my buddy got the Salmon Eggs Benedict and it was phenomenal.  If you are searching for Breakfast/Brunch, do yourself a favor and come here...ask for a table on the patio if it is available and weather is permitting.  I will be back every trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary Cart, table side service
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frites with aioli
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon eggs Benedict...so fresh and delicious

QYcZTHeF9mZADDVMjsZtQg.text: Last minute decision to dine at Morels during our visit to Las Vegas.  We thoroughly enjoyed our service, our appetizers, libations and meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bread with the butter and Kalamata olive spread devine, Crab salad and Lobster
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The filet Mignon, with crab, hollandaise sauce and perfectly prepared asparagus

UMLErldmC1oEWOLw1fj1BA.text: For the average restaurant goer, you order, eat and pay but at Morels, the experience and service is beyond exceptional! From the moment Brandon introduced himself the feeling of being in a restaurant vanished as it suddenly felt like I was sitting at an old friend's dining room table. Along with his friendly conversation and knowledge of the Vegas Strip, Brandon broke down the menu and explained everything ever so perfectly, from the steak and sides, to the sauces and salts. If you're visiting Sin City and looking for a delicious piece of meat that'll visit you in your dreams, look no further than Morels at the Venetian.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

llAj8knZedl-C3BAlASZJQ.text: Literally unbelievable. Here for brunch. Our 2nd or 3rd time here, and it's even better this time than it was the other, awesome, times that brought us back.   If you are anywhere near Palazzo, and you don't go to Morels, you are missing out.   An amazing commitment to excellence. EVERYONE, from the hostesses to the the wait staff to the management, made us feel incredibly welcome and comfortable.   The menu is wonderful, the food is great, and the staff is amazing - not just our head waiter, Tino, but all of the assistants that help out throughout you meal.   Thank you Tino! And thank you to all of the management, especially Louis, for all the hard work put in to make our experience awesome.   I highly highly recommend that you put this place on your agenda. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Tino. Wait staff doesn&#39;t get any better.

GFr3xKJiQIcmTWWGGDDr7Q.text: The food was great, but the service was below average. We ordered bottomless mimosas, the server brought 3 rounds (3rd mostly OJ) I asked for more champagne as OJ gives me headaches and he said no, I asked again and he threw his hands up at me and walked away. Before we left we asked for a mimosa to go (which he suggested before we ordered) and he said no. I find it ridiculous that he ignored a party of 8 in that way. I have been to many brunches in Vegas and I would not recommend morels if you want to have a fun time.

DuhQG7Ak1icvgM0X9p6InQ.text: I hate writing bad reviews. But sometimes it must be done. So here goes.   I'll start with the good stuff first. Decor of the restaurant is absolutely beautiful.  I have dined here twice; once for brunch and once for dinner. In the morning the restaurant is so nice and bright. You can't tell from the entrance of the restaurant, but they have huge windows inside that brings in so much light into the restaurant.  Which is a nice change from being inside casinos all day!  They also have patio seating as well that looks out to Las Vegas blvd and treasure island. Service was great(one of the reasons I gave them three starts, not one).    The bad. FOOD. So for brunch, my particular dish was half good half bad. The potatoes that were on the side were the worst.  It basically felt like they were premade earlier that day and sat around and once ordered, they were scooped and came delivered out to my dish.  They did not seem fresh at all. They were not hot.  They were cold and stale. The rest of my dish however was delicious. Now for dinner, I had the exact experience. My food just didn't seem hot or fresh. I had this crab appetizer that came with bread. And boy that bread looked toasted with butter. But once you took a bite into it... you regretted it instantly. It was so stale and not even warm!  That's when I came to the conclusion that they pre made some items on the menu and it just sits around.   I would skip this place and just trek over to Bouchon in the Venezia tower. Sad to say since they have a great location. Right in the entrance of the palazzo. Not far from taxi and Las Vegas blvd.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of mushrooms
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup.

oW_pNzqMMx3HWUTttuZnnA.text: Visited the restaurant for a quick bite just after our check-in at The Palazzo. The bar offers a great selection of wine and other spirits. The appetizers were really good calamari with a side of spicy marinara sauce were really good. But the star of the show was the cheese and meat spread, ridiculous!!! Delicatessen, good quality cheese, cold cuts, olives, bread, pickles and many other really tasty small bites.   From 12 pm to 1 pm on weekends they have happy hour buy one get two, this special only applies to some of their cocktails and beers, not for top-shelf drinks. They also offer a very extensive selection of bourbons and whiskeys.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the spread
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

Ye_onrEdiLTSm0UDWgkVMQ.text: I come to Morels once a week for a dozen oysters and a couple drinks. EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE I TOP NOTCH! Oysters are fresh and high quality. I wouldn't go anywhere else on the strip for oysters. Everything on the menu is great, when food has been below excellent, the kitchen has recreate the dish to my liking. The service is beyond excellent! I highly recommend as a local and for tourists a great also!!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A variety of oysters with all the high quality fixings I would expect.

2Xb3KF_dKsKiA5GPN13gLA.text: Best brunch offerings on the weekends. Just a click away from making a reso on Opentable. Easy!  Fish and chips ~$15: SO DELICIOUS!!!! Even the fries are fresh ... better than In-n-out! Seafood pasta: AWESOME...it's more like fresh seafood with a side of pasta..love it. Crab omelette: I can pass on this one...lacked some flavor, but the hash was really good. Banana fresh toast: You will like this if you like bananas.  The best part- FRESHLY HANDMADE BLOODY MARY CART! $12 each. I love it. They have a good view on the patio as well.  Our server was the best! Just enough attention and service!  Morels is way better than Bouchon IMHO. They aren't over packed like Bouchon either.  Located next to the Palazzo check in.

jeltZsgZTeC8TS6EfK7J3Q.text: We ate breakfast here and had a couple of crepes and some toast. We had the Mushroom and Gruyere Crepe and the Ham and Gruyere Crepe. Both were very good, but I preferred the Mushroom Crepe.   I do not ask for much in a Crepe. All I need it to be is light, airy, thin, crispy around the edges and have a even light Maillard reaction across both surfaces. The Chefs at Morels met all those Crepe requirements on both dishes. I am a big fan of Gruyere so you cannot trust my opinion on their choice of Cheese as it is most likely biased. The Gruyere in their Crepe was of excellent quality. It had lots of nuttiness and fruitiness. You just know that wheel has Switzerland stamped all over it. The Mushrooms were properly sauteed and seasoned. I had read reviews where people say that their food had no flavor. I am a big proponent of letting the staff know your if food is bland. Thankfully, I did not have this issue on this trip to Morels.   The Toast was a couple of pieces of Brioche, some Jam and Butter. It was a good breakfast accompaniment but nothing I didn't have at home.   I see quite a mixed bag of reviews for Morels. I have eaten here more than a few times and  have always had a good experience with the food. I will continue to eat here as long as that stays True.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cocktail
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom guyere crepe and toast and jam

Djxs1NUw74bZ5QwNlv6Eyg.text: The ambience was great. The service was excellent. And the food was pretty good. My 4-course tasters menu ($45) was pretty good. Not the most filling but did the job. My filet was good. My husband's huge ribeye left much to be desired. I felt like they burnt the outside of his steak making it taste "chared." Not so good considering the price! We've been to DelMonico's before - and we much prefer Delmonicos!

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3.5 oz Filet mignon - 4 course tasters menu
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari appetizer
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tartare

QShrYAVKh5aCVltOlZ-Zmg.text: We ate brunch on a Saturday afternoon. We sat out on the deck, with a view of Treasure Island and the Fashion Mall. My wife ordered the quiche, I ordered the American Breakfast, and my mother-in-law ordered the Seafood Alfredo. My wife's quiche was a small pie slice shape with a lot of pieces of long onion strips. The quiche was runny and didn't have much flavor other than the onions. My american breakfast had 3 eggs with one slice of bread. For 3 over easy eggs, I was left wanting more bread. The sausage didn't seem fresh, and the potatoes were bland. My mother-in-laws Seafood Alfredo didn't have any alfredo sauce, and everything tasted like the salmon that was in the meal. The fruit plate that we order was the best part of the meal. Pineapple, Cantaloupe, Strawberries and Honey Dew were the main items, with some blueberries, honey and yogurt to fill in the plate.  In short, we wouldn't go back. There are plenty of other places that are better at breakfast for a much better price. The place was almost empty and now we know why.

yQrzjoQV09OMTQf2-QDZlg.text: Ate breakfast here today. Very nice looking upscale French bistro. First off, someone needs to explain to one of the younger servers how to make French Press coffee. You press the plunger slowly, not like you are detonating explosives. Picking coffee grounds out of my teeth is not my favorite thing to do while eating breakfast. Wife had the bacon and cheese crepe, it was very tasty and filled her up. I had the American breakfast consisting of over-easy eggs, bacon, and potatoes with pepper and mushrooms. Bacon was very good and not soggy, potatoes were also serviceable but lacked any flavor. The egg whites were so underdone it looked like someone poured a few tablespoons of water on them. Yuk. When we left cash for the bill, the waitress asked if we wanted change. Every time a waiter does this, I mark the review down 1 star.

J6uxnSdE_Y0Fu22Ot3ye0w.text: There are a plethora of fine dining options in Vegas and they are all vying for your dollar. I am thrilled we chose  Morels. I ordered the 35 day aged organic sirloin. I am not an organic nut but I swear this was the finest tasting steak on the planet. A dollop of butter ala Ruth Chris on the top was the perfect complement. Three kinds of salt came with the steak and the brussel sprouts were sublime.   Small, briny oysters began the meal and were delectable but the steak was so superior I skipped right through to the entree. Our server was terrific and the chairs were ultra comfortable. Many superlatives here but deservingly so. Make Morels one of your stops when you visit Sin City because this food is positively decadent.

okQm0KfgZRnaU44lC4Wz-A.text: Wonderful brunch either sitting in their well decorated interior or on the patio overlooking the hustle bustle of the strip.   Prices were reasonable for Vegas and service was very good.   Food was very good and no one had any complaints. I ordered the salmon and locks and portions were great and everything was fresh.   Another thing to note is their bloody mary cart. Pretty crucial after a long night at the tables.

w7Ja0y1eAuEBPs-72nDKCA.text: My husband and I tried the $45 four course tasting menu. It started off with the cheese plate which was unmemorable. Followed by A chilled shrimp...literally one shrimp (altho a larger shrimp). The cocktail sauce was so bland. I had the watermelon arugula salad. The watermelon was flavorful but the salad and dressing were extremely bland and needed a lot of salt. The sirloin was just okay, nothing to write home about. The halibut was okay too but I question the freshness of the fish because it left a weird tingle in my tongue which I've heard happens when fish is not fresh.   The WORST part of the dining experience was that I ordered the cheeseburgers for my son off of the kids menu. The meat came out borderline raw. My son actually ate some of it and only have s few bites I noticed how undercooked the meat was. I should have take a photo as proof. I was so angry and so flabbergasted that they would serve such underdone meat to a child. I showed the waiter and by his reaction he was shocked as well. I sent the food back and they brought out more well cooked burgers.  The service was this place is awful. It's so slow. I was there on a Saturday night and it wasn't event that full and yet the service was extremely slow. We sat on the patio and I felt like we were being ignored because I barely saw our waiter.

m3p_WvR5GV1NXNbJvcUkuA.text: Got the 4 course meal and even though portions are small, you'll be more than satisfied by the end of the meal. Each one of the courses is spaced out a good 5-10 mins till the next and the HALIBUT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. (4 stars solely for that) definitely one of the best I have ever had. So flavorful and yummy! The service was kind of slow and also I would suggest having some French music playing in the background to add to the experience. Also portions for the cheese sampler were tiny (kinda laughable) but yummy nonetheless. Overall a classy/relaxed spot for dinner.

AvOqrBUqmOXN7deLxF8skQ.text: I returned for dinner and had the short rib with a potato puree and some other goodies. The food was delicious and a nice portion. Service was excellent. This was a solid four experience, recommend a visit for dinner.

OF3imSAXGKttIsbG3yQ2PQ.text: We had the tomahawk steak dinner. Hubby's wants today. It was cooked very well and since it was for our anniversary dinner, they gave us some complimentary champagne. And when the dust bunnies flew off the ceiling fan, pre-meal mind you, onto our table and into my eyes (the first time I've worn contacts in 3 yrs!) they offered to move us. :) The service was outstanding. We even had dessert which we never do. Creme brulee trio. Attire is dressy nice -- preppy shorts and polo shirts to cocktail dresses and suits.

5ch82_Qjrv354G9EHxiQ5A.text: Every time I'm in Vegas , I go to this place. So far I have never been disappointed. The meat is great, so is the service and the interior. I really feel welcome here as soon as I have one foot in the door.  Try a cheese selection for desert and then ask them to teach you about it. It's awesome!  Will definately stop by next time again!

Otsp_weNaGLmIWkRX_KZ2Q.text: Great place to dine - had lunch pasta was fantastic- service was a 5 star as well  ate out side - if your in Vegas you are nuts if you don't try this place - clean rear rooms which is always a plus - highly recommend this restaurant!

tq1APQzvTmDmroJqFG7fSg.text: Based on hotel reviews, this restaurant is overrated for food quality and pricing. For a $50+ price for a steak, it definitely did not meet the quality. The bolognese dish was something I could have made at home. Overall overpriced based on quality of food. You have to pay $3+ to TASTE a wine before you choose your preference which is absolutely absurd. Compared to the other restaurants at similar prices, I would not recommend this one.

rPMhoUcnmGN-CWk0VgAOAw.text: Morels: Where mediocre food meets horrible service!  My girl friend and I ate here last night and had an awful experience. It was her birthday, something we had mentioned on our open table reservation, it would have been nice for them to say happy birthday or attempt to make it a pleasant experience for us.  When we were seated, no one came by to give us menus or water for 10 minutes, despite 3 staff seeing our table. When jerry finally came to our table he was very polite but, unfortunately, he was also very inadequate.  The meal consisted of being ignored, getting up from the table to grab a carafe of water to refill our own glasses, empty plates being left on the table (making it difficult to eat our meal due to lack of table space), never offering refills or quality checking in a timely fashion. The manager came over to ask if we needed anything but we had already refilled our own water, he wasn't very helpful.  My friends chicken entree was so bad she had 2 bites and pushed it away but no one asked if it was ok or why she didn't eat it and so we ended up paying for something we didn't eat. My salad was not bad, it was mediocre.  We were visibly annoyed and were not asked how our meal was.  I can't even believe the poor quality of service. I will NEVER eat here ever again and I would recommend that people stay away unless shitty food and service are your thing.  This restaurant is a disgrace and should be ashamed of their staff and embarrassed of their food.

clDnCbXLVtmtWFsnkr7tZg.text: The staff is very friendly!! We love David and Yvette. They are the best. No really. I work in the hospitality industry and this place is where you NEED to go. Don't miss out on the best place in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting in the corner...

3wDw0A1edeF_G3S-QmtEXw.text: The best steak I've had at a restaurant period. I ordered the Grass Fed New York strip medium rare. Yes, they have grass fed beef and organic pastured chickens here.   With a great view of the strip, and outside balcony seating, Morels French Steakhouse is Vegas dinner must.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grass Fed Beef Mode

Xg_luBrKvZ6-AYVuiK-xMg.text: First review and it's really bad. We were a party of 11, so not ridiculous, but certainly not small. Things seemed to start alright and the water and wine we ordered were poured often, but then it went downhill. I expect higher prices in Vegas, but $26 for crabmeat cocktail and it's barely enough for one person is a little ridiculous. The shrimp and tuna were no different. Good for one, but sharing is optional. The meal? Pretty much everyone ordered steak, as you do at a steakhouse.For me, I ordered a bone-in ribeye. After I ordered, found out they didn't have it. Ordered the prime ribeye.  Then we waited. For literally an hour. I think they forgot to put it in and then realized their failure. Why? Out of 10 steaks ordered, 3 were done properly. I ordered medium rare and it was purple on the inside. One ordered well and it was bright pink. Medium well came out medium rare if they were lucky; it was bordering rare. I think they forgot, slapped them on the grill quick, plated and sent them. For a $65 steak, it should be perfect. And the sides? Small, one person sides and overdone. The brussel sprouts were basically black. We had a better meal the night before at the burger place near the food court. Avoid this place.

zaHO_lDYyitI2i8PgtlZ4w.text: Sounded really good. Food was ok Bloody Mary cart good but the employees did not want to be there. Everyone was angry and the service was really poor. No one was proud of where they worked. Asked one guy for something never came. Don't go too many other choices in Vegas.

N0HT1BL22GMeYOlaRx1PCQ.text: I find myself looking for value when dining.  I'm willing to pay more when something is amazing and conversely feel a bit "taken" when a establishments charge appreciably more than my perception of its worth.  That's a bit of what I experienced here..  The food?  I'm a better than average home chef.  I've cooked better steaks at home using high heat methods on my Big Green Egg or pan frying and finishing with a butter garlic glaze.  I was very disappointed with the steak. Nuff said on that..  We had a Crab Appetizer, Caesar Salad, of course the house rolls, and Steak.  I had the bone-in Strip blackened medium rare with heavy spice and a $25 glass of 2009 Cabernet S.  My colleague had the fillet -medium.    The best part of the experience was our waiter a native of Acapulco named Tino (I believe).  He was friendly, funny and thoughtful.  I'd give him 5 Stars.  The final bill came out to $280 and had me wishing we'd visited Hash House a GoGo instead.  If your looking for steak in The Venetian/Palazzo run don't walk to "The Cut" instead.

8hY_H8xRHYrxgJ8RaGWgTg.text: The staff was very polite but the menus given to us were not the same as those displayed outdoors. The mac & cheese tasted very bland with no cheese flavor and the mac & cheese with lobster tasted no better. The other two pasta dishes were extremely small given the high price, and were also lacking flavor.

G5tUl0Hhdrdem-XbwQqW4A.text: They do not have it going on in terms of service.  I think it all starts with the manager who is not sure of himself then switches waiters on you (because a larger group came in) right in mid-service.  It was hard for me to get a drink (to get started) and when I wanted my favorite they said that they didn't carry it.  Later I find out they did.  Talked to the manager and his eyes didn't seem to care.  It was obvious where the problem lies.  Decor was outstanding (the Palazzo) but I should have taken a cue as to how few patrons were in the restaurant.

9UN22sDyxE0l0PPAr72HlQ.text: Just another steak house wasn't great nothing to rave about. It's 5 am and the food is still stuck in my throat! Place is nice but not my style. Would have liked to sit on the patio but it was just too damn hot out. Service was good, but I won't be back. Mediocre food just doesn't cut it! Sorry and its overpriced for the quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Platter
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartar
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Dish

gQgNLKqKG-2iS9LYnTvkaA.text: For a high end restaurant that charges $17 for a small salad, $10 for a potato and $57 and higher for a steak with no side dishes you should not waste your money here. Undercooked asparagus, mediocre scalloped potatoes, average mushrooms, average corn. Steak was not tasty and was burnt on parts.  None of the food was hot.  It was all lukewarm. The hot rolls were tasty. The "fresh roasted Ethiopian" coffee was poorly roasted and the French press was not given 4 minutes before pressing the strainer.  Someone needs to teach these people how to do coffee properly. Very disappointing restaurant.  Do not waste your time or money. I am giving two stars because they should be delivering at least 4 stars and failed miserably.

5FXP3IPHvprUUI5W6t0TWg.text: You must try the breakfast here. I had french toast and pastries and they were mouth watering good. The service was very good as well. The ambience is relaxing and great for mornings.

s_U6BUdoDm_5Apf5Xz5elQ.text: Service was amazing.  A perfect level of attentive and friendly, but not breathing down your neck, staring at you attentive.    Food Tip of the Day:   Get the fondue and truffle fries, ignore the bread that comes with the fondue and dip the fries in the fondue instead.  OMG!  So good that way!

UkPcLjxf4EXLoggxnU9otA.text: Wife and I had our anniversary dinner here.  We wanted seafood and wanted to avoid Italian. Atmosphere and decor are impressive (and part of what you're paying for is atmosphere). Began with a selection of cheeses--a nice and varied list from which to choose--and enjoyed every bite.  We both had fish--salmon for me, halibut for her. No complaints.  Halibut was especially good.  Salmon was a bit on the plain side.  Based on the description I expected that up to a point and was in the mood for a plain bit of fish, but it should have been a bit richer in taste since lentils and bordelaise sauce was a part of the dish.  Bread and butter were perfect, by the way.  We split a dessert and had the cream brulee with chocolate mouse--it's a house speciality.  Very nice, light and tasty.  Throughout our meal the service was superb, always on top of things but never intrusive.

60JOvQtDK0cAQmEDDE1u-Q.text: Brunch was so delicious. Everything we ordered was so good - croque madame, bloody marys, scrambled eggs, cobb salad and THE BEST PANCAKES I've ever tasted - fluffy, moist, vanilla-scented absolute deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary beignets - delicious!
Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really great Cobb Salad!

KW-bLOMO751Molt3q5Zhcg.text: My rating is based on our server . My husband and I just finished eating here . We saw in our hotel on tv , Morels Restaurant and said we need to go there . Arrived during lunch hour . Our server was Brandon . My husband had a coupon from which our hotel gave us . Buy one drink get the next one free. Gave it to our waiter, said he'd never seen that before . Ok so we still ordered our drinks . My husband a Pinot noir and me Prosecco. Ordered the rigatoni and my husband the ribeye . Also ordered a dozen oysters and cheese platter . All in all food was delicious, don't get me wrong . When our bill came ,our server said he couldn't take the coupon and to talk to our hotel or the Grazie desk . Ok , no big deal . When my husband was signing the bill , for the tip he asked how much do we give . I have a tip calculator app . Our total amount came to $ 190.83. So the app said $28.50 for a tip . Instead we gave $25.00. As he walked away with the bill in hand , he opened it and rolled his eyes . I'm like really . Are you serious . Why $25 and not $28 for the tip ? Well first like I said the food was delicious but $40 for oysters etc . The night before , we ate at Table 10 , Emerils restaurant and it was waaaay better than here . Price , quality and service. I understand this is a French restaurant but way overpriced. I mean $ 25 is $25 . I don't know what he was expecting. Lesson learned here . Won't be returning here . Table 10 , I highly recommend. I think we could've gave a $30 tip and he still would've rolled his eyes . Ppl shouldn't be greedy and thankful for whatever they get . Also for this being a French upscale restaurant, the music they played was Elton John Benny and the Jets , Journey etc . Come on . Oysters $40 side of asparagus $14 but we need to listen to this kind of music in a fancy restaurant. Looks like we were the ones who should've been rolling our eyes . Save your $$$ and go to Table 10 instead . No greedy waiters there.

7va7OWFI96pIwVbFWBKZQA.text: This was like my 3rd steak in 3 nights.    I can't even remember what kind of salad I ordered here.  But do remember ordering the filet.  (It's a nicely prepared 8 oz filet.   But you won't walk out raving about the steak.  It's good but not super exceptional.) Vanilla creme brulee - Delicious!  I wanted to order another, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach.  I'd go for a different entree, and stay for the dessert!

0HBr1Y_EQ57R5Op5_dP5Gw.text: I recently went to Vegas for business and had about 10 hours to kill before my trip home. Since the trip was on the company dime, I had little hope that I would find something healthy and tasty enough to fall within Per Diem rates. Morels did not disappoint.  My colleagues and I dropped in for a late breakfast/early lunch armed with a 20% off coupon from The Palazzo, and were delighted to discover that the menu offered enough variety to satisfy everyone in our party. Since I was craving breakfast, I was able to order a free range mushroom and herb omelet, along with several tasty rounds of rich, roasted coffee served in a personal French Press.  The accompanying Pommes Frites were unexpected and appreciated, but a little too salty and heavy.  Wait staff were very friendly and attentive, and more than tolerant of our "frumpy slugs from Ohio" attire. The restaurant seemed shockingly empty for a Friday around noon; however, I appreciated the opportunity to relax in a beautiful and quiet space -- an escape from the bleeps, blips, and incessant smoke that lurks in the casinos just outside.

dVSk2LO2nkT7436j42AzbA.text: I must be on a roll, i have been getting some of the best service in town these days.  every place around town was packed, no reservations, no seating.  but not morels.  it was just the two of us and we just wanted a quick bite before a wedding, so we would be in and out in no time.  the places we went in weren't entirely packed, they could have totally taken us in, but decided we weren't worth it.  Not Morels.  The hostess seated us in the center of the restaurant, told us to take our time, even tho the place was completely sold out on reservations.  they made room for us.  they gave us impeccable service, they fed us delicious food!  even gave me a black napkin so i don't have white fuzz all over my little black dress.    next time, when we have planned better that allows more time for dining, for sure another round at Morels!

KbptL-Vv0MbSnJofhPROog.text: I would first like to address my server Esteve Sabbah and server assistant Michael Lucas, along with manager Kevin Hinderliter if it was not for these 3 Gentleman's downright awesome hospitality my family and I would not have returned for round two tonight.  I had the steak on both of my visits which was a bone in rib eye 20 oz cut of Iowa corn fed beef aged for 28 days cooked medium... EXCELLENT!  My wife the first night had filet mignon 8 oz... EXCELLENT!  Tonight my wife had linguini clam... EXCELLENT!  Our 6 year old Stanley shared with us off of our plates and from the sides.  We ordered sides which were all popping with flavor...EXCELLENT!  Sides of the 2 days were sauteed seasonal mushrooms, steamed asparagus, sauteed green beans in butter, onion rings, and my favorite sauteed broccolini...  To be honest with you I really enjoyed how our sever Esteve Sabbah made the Caesar salad dressing in front of us at the table.  The dressing was made from scratch with several ingredients that we had direct input of quantity during the salad dressing making.   This was just EXCELLENT!...   I will not even try to attempt to explain the robust tastes coming from after meal desserts.  The desserts that we had were just amazing in taste and presentation...EXCELLENT!  I am in a full food coma.  I travel all around and get to eat out several places per year around the United States and I will say without hesitation that this French Steakhouse & Bistro made number one position for my own 2014 dining experiences, hands down.  Much thanks again for their professionalism, personal touch with entertaining my son Stanley, and all around dining experience to my server Esteve Sabbah and assistant Michael Lucas.  We will return again.  Do yourself a favor and request this team they are on top of it!  Happy Holidays guys see you again, The Cook Family.

cs515pRxGdO28BsZKt9jxQ.text: I dined here the night of Monday, August 29th with my wife, the last full day of our vacation in Vegas.  The place was relatively empty at 8:30 p.m.  We both ordered the $45 prix fixe summer dinner menu.  The service was attentive although there was a very long lag time between the first course's cheese and charcuterie and our second course.  Being foodies, my wife and I shared everything except the mussels I ordered for my second course.  The mussels tasted off to me.  I didn't think much of it until I came down with a three-day bout of diarrhea starting the next day around 12 noon.  I'm finally back at work now.

6wkLWFoIzDyoL_9IMFDHQg.text: Came here for breakfast, and I was amazed at how lovely everything was. Our server was very attentive, and nice. The food was perfect. Eggs were nice and soft, potatoes were delicious and the ham was perfection. The most amazing thing though? I never had to put salt or anything on my plate! everything was perfectly seasoned! Oh, and we sat outside. It was hot, but it's nice to have the option of either sitting inside or out. The view outside was a strip view, however the construction across the street can be somewhat of an eyesore. All in all, If you have money to splurge, I definitely would recommend Morels.

photos.caption: Photo of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom Nom!!

qLjbgzS1zEFIJWaVoMEqcw.text: All you can drink Mimosa's for $25 is a pretty good price if you're willing to get your monies worth. The omlette and Club sandwhich is well worth the price and taste. The meals can be taken to go if you cant finish them. If money isn't an issue.. do it!

Dhyfb5Q536cs4hnqx24kkg.text: Had a croque monsieur for lunch, the most decadent I've ever had. Fries that came with the sandwich were also really good. Raw oysters were fresh. Was there for the 2 for 1 happy hour special (which means 2 glasses of wine for the price of 1). Service was good at the bar.

0pFUxjnNKmeL_n2qclsPDQ.text: I ate at Morels for dinner last weekend and I will say it was one of the worst dining experiences of my life.  We sat timely for a 7:30pm reservation and were a large party of 12. After about 10 minutes, a waiter came and took our drink orders. About 20 minutes later, our drinks came. About 30 minutes after that, we GRABBED our waiter and asked him if he was planning to take our order. Finally, he did.   We placed a relatively straightforward appetizer + entree each order. About 15 minutes later, 3 out of 12 people received Caesar Salads that they ordered, but nothing else. Not until we called for the manager, and then waited another 10 minutes, did the remainder of the appetizer orders come. We're talking salads and soups here, nothing too difficult that would warrant so long and such a disconnect from the first salads. The manager was NOT apologetic and was incredibly rushed. He wouldn't really give us the time of day.  The entrees came some time later and were decidedly mediocre. The $120 lobster lacked flavor. The short ribs were dry. The salmon was bland.   There are DOZENS of better restaurants than Morels in Las Vegas. Why would anyone ever choose to eat here? We made the mistake. I recommend that you don't.

lneL51CtFuIUt3i-9exTww.text: Morels is a hidden gem on the strip, particularly for their charcuterie and frommage selection in addition to their raw bar. The enomatic wine system is one of the top around and the patio is great at night. Definitely a stylish date spot.

WT78q5_SAfWcuEcPFMujQw.text: my favorite place for breakfast when in vegas. quiet and serene atmosphere and breakfast is great. lox and bagel, plenty for two to share. the omelets are cooked fully with no runny egg and so fluffy that it melts in your mouth. again enough for two to share. crepes are delightful with vanilla fragrance and delicious fillings. their fruit platter is nice to start the day with as well as their pastries basket. their coffee is just fragrant and strong. orange juice is freshly squeezed and very refreshing. my daughters favorite is their turkey hash. their bloody mary cart is delightful as well.

INBqMwbCa_mvjakfIekmXQ.text: The desserts are delightful. I forget the name, but they look like bite sized chef hats with a creamy toasted filling. My dinner was lovely as well; I believed it had jicama and I have never tasted it so sweet. It was a party of five for my parents and two little brothers who are 3 and 8. They enjoyed the table because I believe you were able to doodle on them (kids love doodle-able tables). Definitely a vegas' finest

Ufbrh-nZbpSYLBF_QlivfQ.text: we just came from dinner here and had really good food served by a young yet professional wait staff. we started with the charcuterie and romaine salad for 2. no disappointments there. then we had a ribeye and the brick chicken which was really good and krispy! the ribeye was not as great but, pretty darn good. we got a side of mashed potatoes (yum!) and the artichoke. the artichoke was the only real disappointment. i come from santa cruz county and was raised on castroville artichokes. they served them dry with a bread crumb topping and very very al dente. we finished with coffee (pressed) and creme brulee, because no one told us they had dessert souffles which take 20 minutes to prepare. the only other disappointment because you're not handed a dessert menu until after the meal...also, if your restaurants name is Morels...should there be at least one morel item in the menu?

PdcTciSR-GRzAQvWgcD7WA.text: The quality of food was fair. Salami was old and rubbery. The service was very sub-standard. Slow service combined with missing food items, non responsiveness, and poor etiquette.   The LA Morels is far superior.

CUeurylIn7_TIufNt68DGg.text: On our second visit to the Palazzo we decided to splash out on our last night in Vegas with dinner at Morels. We turned up in good time for our reservation and were shown to a remote corner of the restaurant with no view, even of the rest of the restaurant. We requested a move which was facilitated but I felt our waiter was unimpressed by our cheek. I was reminded of Steve Martin in LA Story 'Usual table, sir?' 'No, I'd like a good one, please'. However, after this shaky start, things improved greatly. The steaks were magnificent, done exactly to order and accompanied by a very acceptable Pinot Noir preceded by the obligatory Cosmopolitans. The bill, however, for three without dessert, was an eye-watering $350. Special occasions only unless you win big at the tables. Which we hadn't. Should be five stars but only gets four because of the indifferent service and relatively poor value for money.

nLeI_MmpdFojUCji_RGf9Q.text: I came here for brunch with a group of 13 people- joint bachelor/bachelorette parties.  We were all very hungover and we're dying for a good cure in brunch but unfortunately, we left with something to be desired.  We all got different things and everyone had complaints about their food.  A couple people received the wrong orders and everyone's food was less than "yum".  People who ordered medium rare burgers got well done on stale looking broiche.  The "most popular brunch item"- the crab omelette, was dry and tasteless.  My turkey club sandwich required a bunch of salt, pepper, and ketchup because it was completely void of all flavor.  Also, it was supposed to come with avocado which was missing when I got it- when I pointed it out to the waitress, she left and while I thought she was getting me a new sandwich, she was actually just getting me half an avocado instead.  Glad I paid $15 for a bland sandwich with ingredients on the side so I could make it myself.  But not gonna lie- I squeezed my iced tea lemon on the avocado and added some salt to it and that ended up being the tastiest part of my whole meal.  And the fries were good too but I'm not sure how you could really go wrong with fries anyway.    Then there was the service.  We were stuck paying an 18% gratuity due to the size of our group but that's certainly not the type of service we received.  Considering this is a fairly nice restaurant and food wasn't cheap, I thought service would be better.  The waitress was clearly over us and annoyed. Our tab was off by $80 and it was taking awhile for us to figure it out and that irked her too.  Yes we were there for a couple hours but the restaurant was almost empty so what did it matter?  Wish we'd gone to the place in the Paris instead!

hI4-LPrsR8-l-42EVQdLJg.text: Third time here, still great! Tartare to die for, steak skewers great and of course awesome cucumber martini!

NApnKBDV3LinskOm4jDGlw.text: Tom Bachner, the GM is a massive asshole. Normally I would not say this on a public website, but after talking to him on the phone, he was a total prick and offered no assistance or help of any kind...I was just trying to figure out why I was charged 79.00 dollars instead of $20.00. My friends had a really bad meal as well and one got sick within an hour of eating there. The food, I have to say was horrible, the service was extremely bad. Seriously...Pull it together. Skip this restaurant on your next Vegas trip. Zero customer service skills.

Npdta5tT41MyfbwV8qE2oA.text: We couldn't decide where to get a snack, so we ended up here and had a great time. We got fois gras and the beef tartare appetizers (both excellent) and had a few gin and tonics and sat on the patio in the late afternoon sun. Great time, great service. Our bartender (Dan? Ben? man I suck at names) was awesome.

qoqkDqPIw_5sM66fhQ0X0g.text: Quiet at brunch but the food, coffee, and service were above average. My girlfriend liked it even more than I did.  French toast with banana and mascarpone on brioche was excellent and well presented.  Crap benedict would have been perfect if the crab flavors came out a little more. I would order it again. Maybe try the traditional benedict.  Coffee - From Rwanda. Very good!  Prices weren't obscene. $18 a plate. $5 coffee...  OH! I didn't try it because I saw it on the way out, but they have a bloody mary cart the waiter can bring buy and create to taste. Gonna try it next time.  Went back for a snack later in the day. The ceviche tased like rubber fish/shrimp in salsa w/ sage (wtf?). But the oysters, cheese, wine and service all rocked!

Y_ap0OclkeOtlmrcSPUT7Q.text: Caveat-I do not eat red meat.  I picked this place based on reviews and knowing that most of our party loves steak.  The staff were friendly and helpful but you have to wonder when your waiter doesn't know what grade the meat is and seemed confused by questions about the different cuts.  Nonetheless, our meals were all very good (I had halibut) and the salads & desserts were to die for. The sommelier was very knowledgeable and chose great wines or us.  All in all, while Morels didn't quite live up to the hype, it was delicious food in a beautiful setting and I would go again.

__IP_rcQkhaE8K4onjAXfw.text: Had lunch there with a friend. The atmosphere and service were 3 stars but the food was 2.5. The tuna nicoise salad I had could not compare to Bouchon. The tuna was bland and not quite fresh. Just average. The oysters we had though were fresh and tasty. Go there if you are in a hurry but if you want a True dining experience look elsewhere.

4XbS3Ih4pFFvaZOwusWNow.text: We came here for lunch on a Monday afternoon... it was quite empty.  The service is wonderful... we ended up sharing the fondue and a kobe hamburger... the fondue itself was yummy but the bread that came with it was day old and very hard... it wouldn't even get soft with the help of the hot cheese... but other than that it was great... I was too full to really enjoy my half of the kobe burger.

TbTtC19zWrxTW9EGDTQP_w.text: this restaurant sits on the strip side of the palazzo so since the weather was nice (85 and sunny) we sat on the patio.  like some have said, there are times when you don't want to sit outside but it was surprisingly comfortable for late may.  my parents live in vegas so i've seen the strip a thousand times, but the view from morel's onto the strip was just fantastic.  highly recommend sitting on the patio.  the service was good, and our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable.  on his emphatic (too empathic perhaps?)recommendation we ordered the french onion soup and it was quite tasty, very flavorful.  my steak came out next and it was the right amount of bloody goodness, i pretty much tore through it.  kinda wish i ordered the mac n cheese though, apparently it's off the chain.

2IOTnRW_Mvowt9flBgNiJQ.text: Service left much to be desired.  My sever was training a new server which, in retrospect, is laughable.  I ordered the soft shell crab appetizer and was then told they were sorry but that was not available.  Isn't that the kind of information you're given upon being presented the menu?  Am I supposed to guess what they really have?  Disappointed, I move on and order a glass of Pinot Grigio and a pasta entree.  The waiter and trainee leave and I get a text from my friends that they will join me.  I can't get my waiter's attention because he's chatting with his friends on the other side of the room, so I get up and approach him.  When I ask if he can please ask the kitchen to delay my order until my friends have a chance to order he says "no, I ordered that 5 minutes ago."  Am I at McDonalds?  In better restaurants the answer is never "no".  The correct answer is yes, and it's a cheerful yes.  Frankly, I was dumfounded and just stood in front of him until he offered to check with the kitchen.  I returned to my seat and watched him continue his friendly conversation without ever going to the kitchen.  When my food arrived I asked if it could be returned to the kitchen and held until the food for the rest of my party was delivered and this new server kindly obliged.  When the food for the entire table arrived my entree was still hot (thanks to the kitchen), and I assume my wine was still cold, since it had yet to be delivered.  We were all sitting and laughing into our napkins.  The place was practically empty and the guy couldn't remember a glass of wine.  Waiving my hand in the air did serve to gain the attention of what appeared to be a manager who got the wheels of progress in motion and when wonderwaiter finally came with my wine he tried putting on a good face by asking if we'd like more bread for the table.  I believe you can only use the word "more" in instances where there had already been "some" delivered.  One of my fellow diners started laughing so hard I thought he might choke on his bland and altogether unremarkable salad niciose.  I had no intention of choking on my altogether unremarkable fruit de mer linguine.  The dessert list looked enticing but my profiteroles were gummy.  Oh, the wine was very nice, once it arrived.

nJ-_zrTRVLatLS9K2yzgKA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch. It's a nice restaurant, and we were able to actually sit outside while we ate. The food was very good, if somewhat on the small portion size. I had the croque and my husband had the crab oscar benedict. Wish we had the chance to come here for dinner.

WIveeMji7_oIZqSFVI7cEA.text: The Palazzo houses Morels, a french steakhouse and bistro with both indoor and outdoor seating. Sitting outside on a great Las Vegas overcast day made perfect for the Soup du Jour which was a warm tomato puree seasoned perfectly with fresh rolls accompanied with salted butter, very nice size. For a light lunch I went with the Mushroom & Onion Quiche. Perfectly created, the mushrooms were excellent and the service was key. Not too overpriced for lunch. Soup 8.00, Quiche - 14.00.

Ip4EBjt5ectIO85mEz0R1w.text: A nice airy room with a steakhouse feel without the heavy clubiness of many versions of the carnivores palace.  Lunch. Unplanned. Desperate for food before noon and wanting something other than Italian or new American. Default to Morel's since we were staying at the Palazzo.  A steakhouse, a French steakhouse. No expectations and not wanting steak.   Could be a disastrous choice. But French star chef cannot be too bad a choice.  Bouchon made us beleivers in French with American sensibilities. Not seeking an experience, just lunch.    She had the Slow Roasted Turkey Club and I was torn between 2 choices: Seafood Fettucini(me not wanting Italian but a sucker for anything seafood) or the Pork and Veal Meatloof. Our waiter said the Meatloaf for sure.  Done.   A paired glass of red, chosen by our server again.   A sandwich is a sandwich. But this one was memorable in its taste, freshness and the play of ingredients. The bread, Campagne , sliced thin was just the right handle and carb. Meatloaf is meatloaf.  Ground meat. Simple.  Well Morel's creation was a revelation. Texture, taste, finess of flavours accompanied by silky Youkon Gold Potato Puree aka mashers.   Wow.  If you do ketchup with meatloaf this one doesnot need any condiments to make it sing.  How the simple, unassuming plates are done speaks volumes of the chef's ability. Nothing overdone. Just ordinary crafted into extraordinary.  Trusting our server  who could have suggested the higher priced Fettucini and any possible higher priced glass of wine, gives me confidence in a 2nd visit.  Unplanned, no expectations often rewards with a new discovery that must be renewed on another visit.

mgcRgiGR_gXIrDK1Yt4Z7Q.text: Wonderful brunch menu and amazing bloody mary cart!  We ordered Huevos Rancheros and Norwegian Benedict and both were delicious.  Loved it

cYO10Nr82Jz78cRcLXvs2A.text: The service was good, but I have to say I was totally disappointed.  I had been wanting to go there for quite some time and was excited when we finally decided to go for dinner.  The food was just okay and some of it, the leafy salads, just didn't seem all that fresh.  Just a bummer all around.
